title: Transit Driver Caledon
description:
We Are The Employer Brand of Choice. It is our mission to be your best choice when seeking a career in Transportation. We believe in creating lasting relationships with our employees, one built on Trust and Respect.

And our employees would agree, having selected us as a Great Place To Work through the annual survey measuring Employee attitudes at Voyago.

Here’s a look at what makes us A Great Place To Work:

84% Agreed “Voyago is a physically safe place to work…”

80% Agreed “I can be myself at Voyago…”

81% Agreed “Management has kept me well-informed…”

A Great Place To Work Certification means that we take your happiness seriously, and we work hard to ensure you are highly engaged and informed on important topics that keep Voyago on the move.

Help shape the future of mobility. Voyago is currently recruiting for a Transit Driver in Caledon.

Voyago is Ontario’s Leading Mobility company, a subsidiary of Transdev. We’re hiring dynamic, high achievers looking to be Difference Makers within the industry. Voyago continues to advance across Ontario with our multi-model platform covering a variety of segments including Medical Transportation, Student Transportation, and the Public sector with Medium/Micro Rural and Urban Transit, Accessible Needs Para-Transit, and On Demand Mobility.

Our employee success is built on our commitment and emphasis on training and orientation process. Voyago prides itself on the growth of our employees by supporting and encouraging them to develop skills that lead to successful careers.

Voyago believes in the strength of our people and remains committed to our Golden Values statement reflecting our promise of performance to our employees, customers, and communities in which we operate.

Our teams are continuously recognized as top performers in Safety and Client Satisfaction awards. Voyago is proud to be recognized as one of Canada’s Safest Employers and a recipient of the Excellence Award for several years.

We are People and Safety First. So come join us and help shape the future of mobility at a Great Place To Work company.. A manifest is provided daily and Drivers are required to have a solid geographical knowledge of the City of St. Thomas to ensure efficient routing.

Transit Drivers are responsible for driving along assigned routes and adhereing to a preexisting schedule. Customer service and time management skills are essential for this role.

Candidates should ideally demonstrate the following:

  • Possess G, B, E, or F Licence (must be willing to upgrade to minimum 'F class' licence)
  • Possess clean drivers abstract and obtain a recent copy for a driver file.
  • Possess clear criminal record search with vulnerable sector check and provide a recent copy
  • Display safe and defensive driving techniques.
  • Ability to work independently.
  • Have a sound knowledge of Caleldon, Bolton and Brampton
  • Be available to work flexible hours. (service runs 5 days per week)
  • Be physically capable of performing bus washing duties
  • Must have own transportation to work

DUTIES:

The position includes the following duties:

  • Transportation
  • Transportation of special needs individuals
  • Maintain HOS log books and other appropriate paperwork in a timely manner

Shift Information

Split shift Monday to Friday


  • Employee and Family Assistance Program
  • Competitive Benefit Offering
  • Rewarding career with a growing company
  • Great company culture
  • Award Winning
  • Focus on Innovation and Sustainable Environmental Initiatives
  • Subsidiary of Global Transportation Provider (Transdev)


Sounds interesting? Please send your resume and salary expectations directly to Narinder Gill, Recruitment Specialist at narinder.gill@voyago.ca.


Voyago is committed to provide accommodation for individuals with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. Accommodations are available upon request of the internal or external applicant. If you require an accommodation due to a disability for an interview, please notify Human Resources directly to make appropriate arrangements when contacted for an interview.


We thank all applicants however only those under consideration will be contacted.

title: Transit Driver St. Thomas
description:
Transit Driver - St. Thomas

We Are The Employer Brand of Choice. It is our mission to be your best choice when seeking a career in Transportation. We believe in creating lasting relationships with our employees, one built on Trust and Respect.

And our employees would agree, having selected us as a Great Place To Work through the annual survey measuring Employee attitudes at Voyago.

Here’s a look at what makes us A Great Place To Work:

84% Agreed “Voyago is a physically safe place to work…”

80% Agreed “I can be myself at Voyago…”

81% Agreed “Management has kept me well-informed…”

A Great Place To Work Certification means that we take your happiness seriously, and we work hard to ensure you are highly engaged and informed on important topics that keep Voyago on the move.

Help shape the future of mobility. Voyago is currently recruiting for a Transit Driver in St. Thomas.

Voyago is Ontario’s Leading Mobility company, a subsidiary of Transdev. We’re hiring dynamic, high achievers looking to be Difference Makers within the industry. Voyago continues to advance across Ontario with our multi-model platform covering a variety of segments including Medical Transportation, Student Transportation, and the Public sector with Medium/Micro Rural and Urban Transit, Accessible Needs Para-Transit, and On Demand Mobility.

Our employee success is built on our commitment and emphasis on training and orientation process. Voyago prides itself on the growth of our employees by supporting and encouraging them to develop skills that lead to successful careers.

Voyago believes in the strength of our people and remains committed to our Golden Values statement reflecting our promise of performance to our employees, customers, and communities in which we operate.

Our teams are continuously recognized as top performers in Safety and Client Satisfaction awards. Voyago is proud to be recognized as one of Canada’s Safest Employers and a recipient of the Excellence Award for several years.

We are People and Safety First. So come join us and help shape the future of mobility at a Great Place To Work company.

Position Overview

Voyago Paratransit Drivers provide superior customer service and work closely with individuals with special needs. Drivers are required to aid passengers boarding the bus, maneuvering wheelchairs, fastening Q-Straint belts, lifting portable assistive devices, and assisting ambulatory passengers. The Paratransit Driver ensures all passengers, devices and mobility aids are restrained and secure as well as provide passengers with information on fares, schedules, and stops. A manifest is provided daily and Drivers are required to have a solid geographical knowledge of the City of St. Thomas to ensure efficient routing.

Conventional Transit Drivers are responsible for driving along reassigned routes and adhering to a preexisting schedule. Customer service and time management skills are essential for this role.

Primary Responsibilities

The position includes the following duties:

  • Wheelchair transportation
  • Transportation of special needs individuals
  • Maintain HOS log books and other appropriate paperwork in a timely manner

Knowledge & Skill Requirements

Candidates should ideally demonstrate the following:

  • Possess G, B, E, or F Licence (must be willing to upgrade to minimum 'F class' licence)
  • Possess clean drivers abstract and obtain a recent copy for a driver file.
  • Possess clear criminal record search with vulnerable sector check and provide a recent copy
  • Display safe and defensive driving techniques.
  • Ability to work independently.
  • Have a sound knowledge of the City of St Thomas and be capable of planning own routing
  • Be available to work flexible hours. (service runs 7 days per week)
  • Be physically capable of performing bus washing duties
  • Must have own transportation to work

    Shift Information

    Various shifts available - this position is for a casual/part-time driver.

    Why work for us?

    • Employee and Family Assistance Program
    • Competitive Benefit Offering
    • Rewarding career with a growing company
    • Great company culture
    • Award Winning
    • Focus on Innovation and Sustainable Environmental Initiatives
    • Subsidiary of Global Transportation Provider (Transdev)

    Sounds interesting? Please send your resume directly to Kerry Sollazzo, Recruitment Specialist at kerry.sollazzo@voyago.ca.

    Voyago is committed to provide accommodation for individuals with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. Accommodations are available upon request of the internal or external applicant. If you require an accommodation due to a disability for an interview, please notify Human Resources directly to make appropriate arrangements when contacted for an interview.

    We thank all applicants however only those under consideration will be contacted.

title: General Labourer (Will Train!)
description:
Here at Modern PURAIR® we are looking for enthusiastic, customer focused people to join our Technician Team. We offer competitive pay, great incentives, a fun, supportive work environment and thorough practical training.


We are currently accepting full time applications.

NO EXPERIENCE REQUIRED.

ROOM FOR ADVANCEMENT (Project Management, Operations Management, General Manager, Business Development, Sales etc.)

In this role, you will be responsible for:
  • Driving one of our shiny, new Mercedes Sprinter Vans to customer locations at their homes or businesses for pre-scheduled appointments
  • Speaking with customers about the process
  • Using the PURAIR Vacuum and cleaning system to clean the heating, ventilation, and air conditioning (HVAC) system following PURAIR® training and protocol
  • Using our iPad-based invoice and payment authorization system to process customer payments at the job site
  • Keeping your PURAIR Mercedes Sprinter Van properly stocked and ready for work
A successful candidate will:
  • Have a positive, energetic personality
  • Be dedicated to exceptional customer service
  • Have a clean driver abstract and be able to pass a criminal background check
  • Enjoy a supportive and competitive environment
  • Income potential of 60K in your first year of employment
  • Company benefits after 90 days probation
  • Company provided Ipad and Iphone
  • Have open work availability (Please note that to be considered, candidates must have flexible schedules and be able to work weekends)
  • Be able to earn up to $75,000 per year!

We thank all applicants for their interest. Due to the volume of applications received, only those qualified for an interview will be contacted.

title: PT Shuttle Driver - Edmonton North
description:
Before you apply to a job, select your language preference from the options available at the top right of this page.

Explore your next opportunity at a Fortune Global 500 organization. Envision innovative possibilities, experience our rewarding culture, and work with talented teams that help you become better every day. We know what it takes to lead UPS into tomorrow—people with a unique combination of skill + passion. If you have the qualities and drive to lead yourself or teams, there are roles ready to cultivate your skills and take you to the next level.

Job Description:

Become part of a dedicated team at a Fortune Global 500 organization. Envision innovative possibilities, experience our rewarding culture, and work with talented teams that help you become better every day. We know what it takes to lead UPS into tomorrow—people with a unique combination of skill + passion. If you have the qualities and drive to lead yourself or teams, there are roles ready to cultivate your skills and take you to the next level.

Job Summary
This is a part-time position that will be running the airport and 5-ton shuttle to the Edmonton North depot in the early morning. This position practices safe transportation methods while traveling to and from destinations. This position ensures the best customer service through efficiency and dedication. Shift is from Monday-Friday with a 4am start time and a 9am end time. *Shift end may vary depending on operational needs*


Responsibilities:
Delivers and picks up UPS packages efficiently and effectively.
Learns and properly executes UPS safe driving methods.

Qualifications:

  • Occasionally lifting up to 70lbs- handcarts available
  • Valid AB Class 5 non-GDL license
  • No at-fault accidents or more than 5 demerit points in the past three years prior to applying
  • No tickets or moving violations in the past 12-months prior to applying
  • No 5-ton experience required, will train the right candidate
  • Salary: Starting wage is $16 + $2 hourly bonus *current top rate is $27.63 after 4 years.

UPS Canada is a diverse and equal opportunity employer. Please advise our HR representatives if workplace accommodation is needed. Thank you for your interest in UPS Canada.

title: AZ Truck Driver : Ottawa, ON ($27.00 per hour)
description:
**This position is based out of our resident yard in Ottawa**


Are you an AZ driver who is committed to safety and delivering exceptional customer service? If so, Tim Hortons Distribution may just be the place for you! As a certified Great Place to Work, we can confidently say you'll be joining a team of dedicated, professional Drivers who have a passion for our iconic brand. At Tim Hortons Distribution, we understand the importance of work/life balance, which is why as a Driver, you will typically work 4 days a week and know your schedule well in advance.


What's in it for you:

  • Competitive base hourly wage
  • Overtime is paid after 80 hrs. biweekly
  • Immediate company paid Benefits for you and your family
  • Annual Performance Bonus
  • 3 weeks of paid vacation per year
  • Pension plan with Company contributions
  • Immediate RRSP/TFSA options
  • Employee Shares Purchase Plan
  • Annual safety boot allowance
  • Annual uniform allotment
  • Employee Product Purchase Program
  • Majority of local runs meaning you are home at the end of your shift
  • Top of the line equipment
  • Power tail gates
  • Power driver walkies
  • Onboard computers
  • 24-hour office support from transportation supervisor

What we do:

Our drivers safely deliver dry and temperature-controlled products to approximately 1500 Tim Hortons restaurants. We operate 7 days per week nearly 24 hours per day using a variety of trailer sizes to meet delivery demands and constraints.


On the Job:

  • Offloading products using a powered tailgate and powered driver walkie
  • Verifying order accuracy and assisting store employees with bringing the products into the restaurant
  • Providing outstanding customer service and support to restaurant employees
  • Performing Pre and Post trip inspections
  • Completing all appropriate regulatory and Company documentation
  • Safely and professionally operating Company equipment at all times
  • Ensuring food safety and food defense standards are followed
  • Other duties as assigned

Required Skills:

  • Valid AZ driver's license and at least 1 year of experience operating AZ vehicles
  • Clean driver's abstract and CVOR
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (Both verbal and written)
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs
  • Proven track record of reliability and safety
  • Ability to work in a all types of weather and road conditions
  • Lift truck experience is preferred
  • B-Train experience is preferred
  • Flexibility to work days or nights

Driver schedules include a variety of departure times and some weekend work.

title: newHousekeeper - $21.75/hr
description:
Why Vacasa

We started with just one home and an idea: to bring homeowners and renters together with smart technology and caring local teams. Today, we're the largest full-service vacation rental company in North America thanks to the people who give us their best every day. You'll fit right in here if you're curious, entrepreneurial, and thrive in a rapid-growth environment.

Compensation:

  • $21.75-23.00 CAD/hr
  • $500 Retention Bonus

What you'll get

  • Health/dental/vision insurance—100% coverage option
  • Employer Sponsored & Voluntary Supplemental Benefits
  • Registered Retirement Savings Plan
  • Health & Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts
  • Paid vacation & sick days
  • Paid holidays
  • Paid parental leave after one year of tenure
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Career advancement opportunities
  • Employee discounts
  • All the equipment you'll need to be successful
  • Great colleagues and culture
  • Monetary value of benefits equals about $300 per month!
  • Please visit our careers page to review our full benefits offerings

Why Housekeeping at Vacasa

We take pride in our work, knowing our tireless efforts provide peace of mind. We're the vacation heroes—giving guests a spotless first impression and setting the tone for an unforgettable experience. With us, you're more than just a housekeeper, you're a keeper of the house.

What we're looking for

We're searching for an exceptional individual to join our team as a Housekeeper in Whistler This person is a hard-working individual who will embody our values while maintaining the supreme cleanliness of our homes.

What you'll do

  • Professionally clean and maintain Vacasa properties using cleaning procedures and products in conformance with prescribed company standards
  • Sweeping, vacuuming, mopping, dusting, and washing all surfaces
  • Move all reasonably portable furniture in rooms to clean under and behind
  • Assist with laundry as needed
  • Create a welcoming environment for our guests and owners by ensuring homes are clean and cared for
  • Identify and note any damages to homes. Create maintenance tickets as necessary
  • Collect and remove trash and debris
  • Meet and maintain required Housekeeping metrics
  • Attend all mandatory individual and team meetings
  • Replenish consumable items such as soaps and paper products
  • Maintain hot tubs as needed; no experience necessary - we offer on-site training
  • Other responsibilities as assigned - because every day looks different

The skills you'll need and position requirements

  • Reliable transportation
  • Smartphone and personal email address
  • Weekend availability
  • Attention to detail
  • No experience required, we're happy to train you!
  • Ability to stand for extended periods of time, bend, stoop, squat, kneel and lift over 20 pounds

Must be legally eligible to work in Canada. Vacasa is unable to assist candidates in obtaining Canadian work authorization.

Some positions may require that you drive a personal vehicle and/or company vehicle for work purposes. Employees who are required to drive a personal vehicle must have reliable transportation, a valid driver's license, and be at least 18 years of age. Employees who are required to drive a company vehicle must have a valid driver's license, be at least 21 years of age, and have been a licensed driver for no less than 3 years.

Vacasa is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We do not discriminate against applicants based upon race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, or other classes protected by applicable law.

Vacasa is committed to maintaining a safe and productive work environment. Possession, use, or being under the influence of alcohol or illegal drugs in the workplace is prohibited.

An offer of employment for this role will be contingent upon the successful completion of a background check.

title: newDrilling Rig Jobs - Canada
description:
Get a career that has space for your lifestyle. Precision Drilling can offer a career that has room for your professional, personal, and family ambitions.


Do you have what it takes to work with Precision Drilling?? We are always looking for HIGH PERFORMANCE/HIGH VALUE fulltime seasonal employees. We also look for a willingness and flexibility of candidates to work in both camp and non-camp situations. We are hiring throughout Western Canada to fill the following positions:


Leasehand

Floorhand

Motorhand

Derrickhand

Driller


**Willing to train for entry level positions**


ABOUT PRECISION DRILLING

Precision Drilling is Canada’s largest drilling contractor with a fleet of 108 well-maintained drilling rigs including Single, Double, Triple and Slant rigs. Our rigs and our employees are known as the best of the best, in terms of safety, technology and service to our customers.


ABOUT THE JOB

The Floorhand is responsible for safely and efficiently performing a variety of physically demanding tasks on and around the drilling rig, supporting equipment, structures, and rig systems. Responsibilities of the Floorhand include:

  • Ensure the Rig is kept clean and tidy; housekeeping activities on and about the rig including cleaning, washing, chipping, painting, and garbage disposal
  • Always keep all stairs free of ice and debris, whenever possible
  • Keep the doghouse and tool house clean and organized with equipment out of the way and properly organized
  • Operate manual tongs and slips to connect and disconnect various tubulars
  • Perform repairs and preventative maintenance of the drilling equipment and other components of the rig while adhering to Precision maintenance standards
  • Identify any possible problems on and around the rig and assist crew members with repairs
  • Keep the Rig Manager well informed of any issues and repairs done on site
  • Assist the Rig Crew with their daily duties on the rig
  • Complete training programs as required
  • Actively participate in safety meetings, adhering to all applicable Policy and Procedures
  • Actively participate in Observation program, and step in and correct at risk acts
  • Assist with moving the rig, this includes rigging up and rigging down/out
  • Assist with tripping, nipple in and out, and preforming preventative maintenance
  • Follow policies, understand Key Beliefs, Target Zero Rules, and Core Values
  • Actively aware of all safety hazards and ensure correct safety precautions are taken
  • Wear appropriate PPE wherever applicable
  • Act as an extra set of hands for the rig with various other duties
  • Keep crew truck clean and inspected before use
  • Drive in safe manner

QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS

  • A valid driver's license as well as transportation to and from rig site
  • Must be self-motivated and possess a strong work ethic
  • Ability to communicate effectively with others
  • Ability to follow instructions and take direction
  • Willingness to read and understand Precision’s Key Beliefs, Target Zero Rules & Stop Work Authority
  • Ability to carry up to 75lbs throughout a shift of work

STARTING WAGE: $33.00-$46.50 per hour + Waived waiting period for single/family extended health and dental benefits

title: newClass 1 Truck Driver
description:
Gurna Logistics Inc. is looking for class 1 driver to fill our long-haul driving position for Western Canada runs. Main lanes are AB, BC, SK and MB.

Credentials:

· Class 1 Driver's license

· Clean Driver’s abstract

Skills Required:

· Minimum 6 months experience required

· Able to lift up to 50 lbs

· Speak Basic English

· High school Certificate

· Good knowledge of log books, inspection reports and Bill of ladings

· Punctual, and takes pride in being first in line to load and unload

Job Duties

Load and unload goods, Ensuring safety and security of cargo, Receive and relay information to central dispatch, Record cargo information, hours of service, distance travelled and fuel consumption, Perform pre-trip, en route and post-trip inspection

Candidates on open work permits are also welcome to apply. LMIA available. Can train new driver as well.

Please apply with resume and commercial drivers abstract by email. We thank all interested applicants, but only suitable candidates will be contacted. Gurna Logistics is looking to fill this position as soon as possible.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $5,000.00-$7,500.00 per month

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday
  • No weekends

title: newEntry Level – Operations Team
description:
Western Dispatch is looking for a highly motivated individual to fill an entry level position in our Operations Department. We are looking for candidates with a positive attitude and willingness to learn and grow. No prior industry experience is necessary.

We abide by the philosophy;

“Hire for Attitude, Train for Skill.”

For the last 40 years we have been a leader in Express Courier and Freight Distribution solutions, servicing Greater Edmonton and the province of Alberta. Our work involves supplying our clients with an exceptional, cost effective delivery service. The name of game for us is SPEED, with delivery windows as low as 45 minutes.

How do we stay at the forefront of courier and distribution innovation while maintaining an exemplary On-Time performance for urgent, time sensitive deliveries? Our success starts with individual people who are inspired in their work. We’ve created a fun, high-octane atmosphere where our team members are encouraged to share feedback and implement workplace improvements.

What is Operations?

The Operations Team is the nerve center of our organization. Our job is to manage the inner workings of the business, so it runs as efficiently as possible. We are constantly thinking and rethinking our systems and processes, always looking for improvements. All this while managing the day-to-day operations of the company.

As a member of our Operations Team, you’ll be;

  • Designing and building rating structures and providing quotes to our client
  • Managing accounts and ensuring client satisfaction
  • Analyzing data to improve routes and maximize vehicle volumes and revenue
  • Managing our fleet of drivers. Ensure drivers are showing up to work on time, vehicles are in good condition and drivers are in uniform and with proper PPE
  • Monitoring KPI’s and other metrics to ensure productivity goals are being met
  • Supporting functions of other departments (order entry, billing, invoicing, warehouse)
  • Participating in SCRUM and Brainstorm meetings designed boost creativity and share ideas
  • Increasing brand awareness and engagement through our website and social media accounts
  • Participating in Team Building Exercises. Giant Jenga anyone?

Knowledge and Skills

Our ideal candidate will have the following assets;

  • Experience in a leadership/management role
  • Intermediate experience with Microsoft Excel and Word
  • Proven ability to effectively manage multiple projects and tasks
  • Bias for action, with strong problem-solving skills
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills

What we Offer

  • Extended Health and Dental Benefits
  • Profit sharing
  • Career development opportunities
  • Dynamic business culture
  • Meditation/Yoga space

And lastly, before you apply ask yourself these questions?

Do I have the skills outlined above? Do I have the personality to succeed in this work environment? Do I want my voice to be heard and my ideas to be explored? Do I want a fulfilling job where I'm not just another cog in the corporate machine?

If you answered yes to these questions, then we look forward to reading your resume.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $60,000.00-$80,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • Profit sharing
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift

title: newLead Housekeeper
description:
**Please note that this position is located in Big White, BC.

****$500 BONUS OPPORTUNITY**** (paid in 2 parts)

Why Vacasa

We started with just one home and an idea: to bring homeowners and renters together with smart technology and caring local teams. Today, we're the largest full-service vacation rental company in North America thanks to the people who give us their best every day. You'll fit right in here if you're curious, entrepreneurial, and thrive in a rapid-growth environment.

Why Housekeeping at Vacasa

We take pride in our work, knowing our tireless efforts provide peace of mind. We're the vacation heroes—giving guests a spotless first impression and setting the tone for an unforgettable experience. With us, you're more than just a housekeeper, you're a keeper of the house.

What we're looking for

We're searching for an exceptional individual to join our team as a Lead Housekeeper. This person is a hard-working individual who will embody our values while maintaining the supreme cleanliness of our homes. This person will manage a small group of housekeepers in Big White, BC and work closely with the local management team.

While this position is considered part-time, you may have the opportunity to obtain full-time employment based on your skill set and the company's growth. Hours can and will vary weekly and seasonally based on business needs.

What you'll do

  • Professionally clean and maintain Vacasa properties using cleaning procedures and products in conformance with prescribed company standards
    • Sweeping, vacuuming, mopping, dusting, and washing all surfaces
    • Move all reasonably portable furniture in rooms to clean under and behind
    • Assist with laundry as needed
  • Create a welcoming environment for our guests and owners by ensuring homes are clean and cared for
  • Assist with scheduling, distribution of tickets, ordering and organizing supplies, as assigned by the manager
  • Provide input on performance evaluations, resolving problems, and implementing disciplinary action with assistance from your manager and Human Resources
  • Identify and note any damages to homes. Create maintenance tickets as necessary
  • Manage, mentor, train, and support a small group of Housekeepers
  • Ensure the housekeeping staff follows through on assignments and provide guidance on work methods and routines such as follow the wall, standard unit of appearance, and reporting damage.
  • Perform inspections of cleans completed by Housekeepers
    • Touch-up cleans as needed
  • Establish and maintain open, collaborative relationships with team members and management team
    • Correspond on a regular basis with your local management team and team members
    • Be available and willing to assist your colleagues and management team when necessary
  • Provide cross-coverage for your manager and Co-Lead Housekeeper(s) when necessary
  • Collect and remove trash and debris
  • Meet and maintain required Housekeeping metrics
  • Attend all mandatory individual and team meetings
  • Replenish consumable items such as soaps and paper products
  • Other responsibilities as assigned - because every day looks different

The skills you'll need

  • Reliable transportation/Valid B.C. Drivers License
  • Smartphone and personal email address
  • Driving inclement weather conditions as required
  • Availability to work Sunday through Saturday, early mornings and evenings as needed.
  • Ability to work well under pressure in a fast-paced environment
  • Lead by example while embodying our company values
  • Highly responsive and reliable
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Prior housekeeping experience preferred although we can teach you the Vacasa standard
  • Ability to stand, sit, and walk for an extended period of time.
    • Reach overhead and below the waist
    • Push, pull, and lift less than or equal to 20 pounds
    • Bend, stoop, squat, kneel, and twist
  • Adhere to all company policies and procedures
  • Reasonable comfort level with computers and smart devices
    • Access to the internet and the ability to check your email on a daily basis

Compensation

  • $23.50/hr

What you'll get

  • Extended Medical and Dental
  • Registered Retirement Savings Plan - company match
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Career advancement opportunities
  • Employee discounts
  • All the equipment you'll need to be successful
  • Great colleagues and culture
  • $500 sign-on bonus paid in 2 parts

Vacasa is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We do not discriminate against applicants based upon race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, or other classes protected by applicable law. Veterans are encouraged.

Vacasa is committed to maintaining a safe and productive work environment. Possession, use, or being under the influence of alcohol or illegal drugs in the workplace is prohibited.

Some positions may require that you drive a personal vehicle and/or company vehicle for work purposes. Employees who are required to drive a personal vehicle must have reliable transportation, a valid driver's license, and be at least 18 years of age. Employees who are required to drive a company vehicle must have a valid driver's license, be at least 21 years of age, and have been a licensed driver for no less than 3 years.

An offer of employment for this role will be contingent upon the successful completion of a background check.

title: Home Instruction for Parents of Pre-school Youngsters (HIPPY...
description:
Home Instruction for Parents of Pre-school Youngsters (HIPPY) Coordinator

Alberta Immigrant Women & Children Centre is a registered charitable organization in Edmonton, Alberta. AIWCC, assist and provide support to women and children in need. We recognize, respond to, and focus on the specific concerns of immigrant and refugee women and their families.

The HIPPY Program engages families and children aged 3 year- 5 years in early childhood literacy and school readiness. It’s an early childhood enrichment program which works with parents of young children with a focus working with isolated and disadvantaged newcomer’s communities. HIPPY uses a peer education model to deliver a structed one on one home visiting program and regular HIPPY events, which provide parents, with skills, recourses, and materials to prepare their children for school and support the transition to schools.

Educational Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in early childhood, elementary, family, or adult education, social work, or any other related field.

Other Qualifications:

  • Strong training and leadership skills
  • Strong oral and written communication skills
  • Strong background in project/program management
  • Demonstrated knowledge of and sensitivity to the needs and interests of newcomer families
  • Willingness to work as part of a team
  • Demonstrated administrative and organizational skills
  • Good computer skills
  • Prior experience in one or more of the following areas is an asset: educational administration, community mobilization, parent empowerment / family support, child/family advocacy or staff development

Responsibilities:

After successful completion of the pre-service training seminar, the HIPPY Coordinator has a responsibility for:

  • Carrying out the HIPPY program in accordance with the terms of the contract
  • Recruitment and selection of eligible HIPPY families and home visitor staff
  • Ongoing supervision and training of Home Visitors, which may include the planning and execution of a staff development plan
  • Making occasional home visits
  • Planning and holding monthly group meetings that include role playing
  • Data entry for statistical purposes
  • Establishing effective partnerships with other human service organizations in order to ensure quality service delivery to participating families
  • Participation in regional and national HIPPY conferences, in-service training, and meetings.
  • Ensure weekly home visits and regular HIPPY events are facilitated in a timely and comprehensive manner
  • Coordinate annual HIPPY graduation ceremony
  • Maintain and continue to develop appropriate and organized administrative system, including regular reporting, data, and issues documentation
  • Effective use of computers for word processing, spreadsheets, data entry and promotional materials
  • Maintain accurate HIPPY delivery visits record, forms and statistical information.
  • Ensure all the data and reporting requirements for HIPPY Edmonton are submitted in accordance with specified timelines.
  • Ensure quarterly compliance data in entered into ETO Online Data Management System.
  • Use principles of best practice to provide an innovative and responsive program.
  • Use continual improvement approach to review and evaluate the program and practices.
  • Comply with organizational effectiveness strategies for the HIPPY Program including participation in review and planning visits with the funding agency.
  • Co-operate with current research projects and participate in additional research and evaluation as required.
  • Recruit, train, and support HIPPY Home Visitors to deliver the program.
  • Facilitate weekly HIPPY Training & Enrichment sessions.
  • Build capacity within HIPPY Home Visitors, with the aim of supporting longer term career opportunities.
  • Establish, lead, coach and inspire an engaged and productive team.
  • Provide support, guidance, coaching, leadership, and empowerment to the team including feedback through performance reviews and regular supervision.
  • Undertake regular supervision and performance review with the program manager, providing feedback to promote collaborative working relationships.
  • Promote and maintain a positive, respectful, and enthusiastic work environment
  • Attend mandatory trainings and meeting sessions.
  • The successful candidate must have a driver's license and access to a vehicle.
  • Valid criminal records check.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $26.00-$29.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Edmonton, AB T5A 1C6: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Application deadline: 2022-06-25
Expected start date: 2022-07-04

title: Train Testing Driver
description:
Why join us?

SNC-Lavalin provides cutting-edge engineering, procurement, construction and financing solutions to projects in more than 100 countries around the world. From the Canadian Arctic to the Southern African region and Australasia, our multicultural workforce is driven by a fierce pride in their work and a pioneering vision.

SNC-Lavalin is truly a global leader in its field and has been chosen to design and build some of the most prestigious projects in the world.

How will you contribute to the team?

To perform this role successfully, the candidate will be responsible for but not limited to the following:

  • Drive trains, hi rail equipment and light vehicles either in cabs or with remote controls.
  • Assist in developing the daily schedules.
  • Follow Driver checklist for Train pre use inspections based on Supplier.
  • Understand and support maintenance work happening on the tracks they drive on, and any rule changes.
  • Operate points (levers that switch tracks).
  • communicate with train control, other drivers and shunters, and track level workers.
  • prepare and write Step Backs for job site safety following Project processes.
  • act promptly and comply with safety rules during emergencies or breakdowns.
  • identify and report faults and assist the supplier technicians in repairing faults with their equipment.
  • Provide snow removal along tracks, stations and work areas within the Yard and Mainline.
  • Wear, use and maintain PPE needed for all conditions and jobs assigned.

What will you contribute?

Skills and knowledge -

Train drivers need to have knowledge of:

  • Minimum 2 years relevant experience.
  • Emergency and safety procedures and first aid.
  • How to operate an LRV and its mechanics, including air brakes and electrics.
  • Rail-operating codes and signals.
  • Safety rules and regulations.
  • The correct way to use radio equipment.
  • Shunting (pushing and pulling trains).

Working conditions -

Train drivers:

  • Do shift work, including nights, weekends and public holidays.
  • Work in drivers' cabs, outside in railway yards, and on train tracks in all weather and light conditions.
  • Work in conditions that are inherently hazardous (because they work with large machinery), and sometimes stressful (because there is a risk of hitting cars, animals or people on the tracks).
  • Working outside, day or night, in all weather conditions.

What we offer at SNC-Lavalin?

At SNC-Lavalin, you will enjoy good compensation, a safe and healthy work environment, and a full range of benefits (ie.: group insurance, retirement savings plan, share purchase plan, continuing education program, etc.).

  • Opportunity to work on various projects of various sizes.
  • Competitive salary.
  • Motivational financial package & flexible benefits.
  • Defined contribution pension plan in which SNC-Lavalin contributes.
  • Work equipment provided according to the season (boot, bib, helmet, gloves, etc.).
  • Employee Share Ownership Plan (ESOP).
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP).
  • Learning and Development programs, training, career opportunities.

Additional Information:

Appropriate accommodations will be provided upon request throughout the recruitment and hiring process as required by Company policy and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA).

Successful applicants will be notified about SNC-Lavalin’s accommodation policies at the time the employment offer is extended, and the information will be shared with new personnel during the onboarding process.

At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.

SNC-Lavalin cares about your privacy. SNC-Lavalin and other subsidiary or affiliated companies of SNC-Lavalin (referred to throughout as “SNC-Lavalin”) are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice on our Careers site to know more about how we collect, use and transfer your Personal Data.

By submitting your personal information to SNC-Lavalin, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

Founded in 1911, SNC-Lavalin is a global fully integrated professional services and project management company and a major player in the ownership of infrastructure. From offices around the world, SNC-Lavalin's employees are proud to build what matters. Our teams provide comprehensive end-to-end project solutions – including capital investment, consulting, design, engineering, construction, sustaining capital and operations and maintenance – to clients in oil and gas, mining and metallurgy, infrastructure and power. On July 3, 2017, SNC-Lavalin acquired Atkins, one of the world's most respected design, engineering and project management consultancies. https://www.snclavalin.com

title: Air Duct Cleaning Technician (Will Train!)
description:
Here at Modern PURAIR® we are looking for enthusiastic, motivated, customer focused individuals to join our Technician Team as an "Air Duct Cleaning Technician". We offer great pay, great incentives, a fun, supportive work environment and thorough practical training.

We are currently seeking 2 Furnace & Air Duct Cleaning Technicians to join our team based in Penticton, BC. Previous experience is not required, we will train the right candidates. In this role, you will be responsible for completing Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning and Duct Cleaning for our Residential and Commercial Client base.

A successful candidate will:
  • Have a clean driver abstract and be able to pass a criminal background check
  • Have a positive, motivated, energetic personality
  • Able to successfully work in both team/independent environments
  • Be dedicated to exceptional customer service
  • Enjoy a supportive and competitive environment A PURAIR® Furnace and Duct Cleaning

Technician can expect:
  • To earn up to $35/hr with profit sharing
  • Once graduated from training, post-3-month probation, you will become part of our Profit Sharing payout structure
  • Extended health and dental benefits after 90 days
  • Company-provided iPhone/iPad/Uniform
  • To work for a highly reputable company with a strong vision for the future

A successful candidate will:

  • Have a positive, motivated, energetic personality
  • Maintain time management
  • Have a knowledge of small hand tools
  • Able to successfully work in both team/independent environments
  • Be dedicated to exceptional customer service
  • Have a clean driver abstract and be able to pass a criminal background check
  • Enjoy a supportive and competitive environment

This job pays up to $35/hr with Profit Sharing

title: newBus Cleaner / Wash Bay Attendant
description:
Wash Bay Attendant - Temporary

PWTransit is currently seeking a temporary Bus Cleaner / Wash Bay Attendant to join our team in Leduc. This position would be temporary for 4-6 weeks with the possibility of extension and the opportunity to train as a driver. The Wash Bay Attendant is responsible for cleaning both the interior and exterior of PWTransit’s fleet of buses and light duty vehicles. Leduc residents are preferred.

Qualifications:

  • Minimum Class 4 driver's license required
  • Experience driving commercial vehicles considered an asset
  • Clear driver's abstract
  • Previous vehicle detailing and / or bus operator experience considered an asset

Position Details: ​

  • Paid training provided at $18.70/hour; regular rate of $21.96/hour after training
  • Monday to Friday schedule; 7 hours per day

Responsibilities:

  • Clean the interior and exterior of various vehicles as determined by the Company
  • Clean the bus advertising and back-lit lighting, report any interior lights that are not working
  • Replace interior and exterior advertising signs when required
  • May be required to pre-trip a spare bus
  • Cleaning undercarriages, wheels and vehicle parts
  • Miscellaneous building cleaning duties, dumping trashcans and washing floors when assigned
  • Keep cleaning supplies up to date by requesting items from Management
  • May be assigned incidental tasks of a janitorial nature or general clean up and painting duties that are commonly associated with the operation of a maintenance center and bus parking/servicing garage
  • Spare driving duties as required

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $21.96 per hour

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

title: newDriver
description:
Do you possess EXCELLENT CLIENT SERVICE skills?

Do you understand the importance of TIMELY deliveries?

Are you a SAFETY CONSCIOUS individual?


For over 60 years, Manderley has been passionate about creating living green space for beautiful, healthy communities by providing high quality, innovative lawn and garden products. We’re Canada's largest sod producer and leaders in the landscape industry, but still have a small, family-feel. We believe that the success of our company and high employee satisfaction comes from great teamwork, ensuring everyone has an opportunity to contribute, be heard, learn new skills, and have fun. If you’re someone who enjoys a challenge, who’s driven to solve problems and brings a positive attitude to the table, you’ll fit right in at Manderley.


For more information on our company, our products and our culture, visit www.manderley.com/careers


Based in Edmonton, you are customer service focused and professional when providing local deliveries to our clients. Drivers can wok 40–70-hour work weeks and occasional weekends in our peak season. Drivers may be required to use automated routing equipment. Truck Drivers require commercial drivers' license.


Truck can encounter all kinds of road, weather, and traffic conditions. The number of hours a driver may drive in a given period is subject to regulation.


Compensation is hourly rate of $30, plus overtime, potential for bonuses, and contribution into a seasonal health plan.


Core Competencies

  • Quality Orientation
  • Time Management
  • Accountability and Dependability
  • Decision making and Judgement
  • Operating Equipment
  • Ethics and Integrity
  • Planning and Organizing
  • Communication

Job Duties

  • Deliveries for retail and commercial clients
  • Perform trip inspections on equipment operated and load, ensuring safety and roadworthiness
  • Comply with applicable legislation including safe operation, carriage of goods, driver's hours of service, occupational health and safety
  • Check vehicles before driving them to ensure that mechanical, safety, and emergency equipment is in good working order.
  • Report vehicle defects, accidents, traffic violations, or damage to the vehicles.
  • Maintain electronic logs of working hours and of vehicle service and repair status
  • Record and maintain required documentation including driver logbook, bills of lading, etc. by manual or electronic means
  • Assist in loading and unloading of trucks, including tarping and strapping of load
  • Deliver to product and proper paperwork to our customers in a courteous and timely manner
  • Operate transport and loaders in a safe manner
  • Use Smart Phone to capture delivery information


Requirements

  • 3+ years’ experience driving transports
  • Class 1 license
  • Must provide a 3-year driver abstract
  • B-train experience and forklift certification an asset
  • Positive attitude and strong communication skills
  • Must be able to work with little supervision; must be self-directed

Work Conditions

  • Travel required
  • Will be required to work both indoors and outdoors
  • Overtime as required
  • Weekend work may be required
  • Ability to lift 50 pounds

If you are an experienced driver that is customer focused and enjoys driving newer equipment, we want to hear from you!


Manderley welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request of candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.


Send resume to careers@manderley.com


At Manderley we are a Team. We support one another and work together to succeed.


We are committed to customer service excellence! Manderley produces, distributes, and sells quality sod & landscape products to commercial and retail customers nationally.

title: newCarman Helper - Willing to train
description:
If you are willing to learn, we are willing to train you. If you have a bit of mechanical experience it would be an asset.

The Carman Helper is responsible for the maintenance and repairs of rail cars and their components, they will receive on-the-job training.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

The selected candidate will perform the following functions:

  • Total commitment and focus on safety in the workplace.
  • Compliance with all G&W safety and environmental rules.
  • Inspects car components for compliance with AAR, FRA and customer requirements and standards.
  • Performs all scheduled, on-request, and preventative maintenance and repairs on all types of railcars as identified by the Railcare work order.

This includes, but is not limited to, maintenance, repairs, and component replacements of;

(Draft system, Trucks, Car Body, Lids and Hoods, Underframe, Load restraining devices, Floors, Roofs and hatch covers, Boxcar doors and tracks, Brake system and related components)

Safe operations of oxy/gas torches, hand tools, pneumatic tools, hydraulic tools, electric and battery operated tools, jacks, lift truck, skid steer, mobile crane, overhead cranes, welding machines, company vehicles, etc.

  • Repairs, removes or replaces components with the use of the correct, and appropriate tools and equipment required for the task.
  • Completing all required paperwork in the course of railcar repairs.
  • Setting up work area and equipment (including equipment inspections), including but not limited to, welding machines, torches, tools, etc.
  • Safe and proper use of Blue Flags and Derails.
  • Mobile repairs, as required.
  • Cleaning the shop and facilities as required.
  • Other duties as assigned.

REQUIRED SKILLS AND/OR EXPERIENCE:

  • Must possess a high school diploma or GED.
  • Welding experience is preferred.
  • Frequent bending, stooping, squatting, kneeling, performing overhead work, lifting/carrying up to 50 pounds (22kg) and occasionally up to 85 pounds (39kg).
  • Be physically and mentally able to work at heights up to 30 feet (9.25m).
  • Possess a good grasp of the English language, including good reading and writing skills.
  • Possess a basic knowledge and familiarity with hand tools, pneumatic tools, hydraulic tools, electric and battery operated tools, and other equipment.
  • Work indoors and outdoors in varying weather and environmental conditions.
  • Must possess a valid driver’s license.

Other working conditions: Vacation, benefits and paid holidays are based on the company’s policies.

If considered for the position a full background check will be required (physical, drug, criminal and references).

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From $19.88 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Employee assistance program
  • Life insurance
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Hamilton, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Education:

  • Secondary School (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • driver's licence (preferred)

title: newDispatcher
description:
Responsibilities:

· Develop delivery routes and maintain contact with drivers throughout the day

· Collaborate with management to modify daily routes to accommodate the needs of customers

· Act as a communication liaison and answer incoming phone calls from drivers on the road

· Cultivate strong relationships with drivers and customers to reduce the stress that comes with last minute schedule changes

· Monitor any sudden route changes or road construction issues and work with drivers to establish new routes for timely deliveries

Flexibility in work schedule and function and willingness to cross-train

Successful Candidate must be/have:

· Strong knowledge of the roadways throughout the immediate area

· Ability to work in a team environment in high pressure situations

· Strong written and oral communication skills are essential

· LTL Freight experience an asset

· Proficient computer skills including dispatch software, word, excel, etc.

· Ability to pass a criminal record check

We offer competitive wages including a superior benefits package. Steady full time year round employment.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $20.00-$25.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Employee stock purchase plan
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift

title: newBus Driver
description:
First Canada, our nation's largest provider of bus passenger transportation, has openings for Casual Transit Driver (Operator) in our Central/Upper Fraser Valley operations.


RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Enjoy interacting with the public
  • Maintain a clean and professional appearance and demeanor
  • Drive one of several different coach/buses or company non-revenue vehicles in a safe, courteous, and reliable manner throughout the contracted service area within a daily assigned time schedule
  • Maintain the appearance of the interior of the bus
  • Perform pre/post trip vehicle inspections as required
  • Assist in the boarding of passengers using wheelchairs or other mobility aids
  • Complete and submit written reports concerning passengers and all accidents, and communicate with dispatch as required.
  • Operate on-board computer fare boxes and destination signs
  • Perform all other duties assigned
  • Ability to work in both Abbotsford and Chilliwack locations

EXPERIENCE

  • A demonstrated background in interactive customer service including retail, service, security, health care, education, etc.
  • The ability to obtain BC Class 2 license with airbrake endorsement
  • A record of safe and responsible driving over the past 5 years
  • Ability to work in both Abbotsford and Chilliwack locations
  • A willingness to work a variety of shifts
  • A good general knowledge of the demographics of the service area
  • A clean, “No Contraventions” Driver’s Abstract
  • To be able to pass vulnerable sector records check
  • To be able to pass drug and alcohol testing
  • A Class 1 or 2 BC Drivers’ license is helpful, but not necessary. We will train suitable candidates.

WORKING CONDITIONS:

  • Transit environment: early, split & late shifts may be required
  • Safety focused, clean respectful environment
  • Interaction with the public

Your attached resume showing how your experience relates to the above requirements would be most helpful.


We aspire to have a culture where all people are First. We strive to attract and retain a diverse workforce therefore all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment. We encourage applications from women, persons with a disability, Indigenous peoples and members of a visible minority. First is an equal opportunity employer and by doing so we will sustain and promote an inclusive culture that supports future growth for all. First is committed to providing reasonable accommodation at all stages of the hiring process and encourage all applicants who may require such accommodation to let us know

title: Haul Truck Operator - Maintenance
description:
Position: Haul Truck Operator - Maintenance

Project Type: Mine Maintenance

Project Location: Imperial Oil Kearl

Shift: Day or Night

Schedule: 14/14 ; 11.5 hours per day

Accommodations: Camp

Travel Details: Charter flights from Calgary and Edmonton

GC: Graham

Allied Partner: Heartland Constructors Inc.

Reference Number: 13571


INCENTIVE AND RETENTION ALERT!


Temporary incentive and retention program effective until July 1st, 2022:

  • The Incentive Program consists of an additional $60/day for this position - paid weekly. To receive incentive, "days worked" will be defined as minimum 4 hrs of work on site.
  • The Retention Program offers an additional $20/day, paid by July 1st, 2022 (or following corresponding pay period), or upon release by the employer (end of project).


For more details, apply today!


Heartland Constructors Inc. is seeking Haul Truck Operators to join the IOL Kearl Lake Mine Maintenance team on site near Fort Mackay, Alberta.

This is a permanent position on a 14/14 shift schedule.


Responsibilities

  • Operating haul truck
  • Execute assigned tasks in a safe and efficient manner
  • Ability to work unsupervised
  • Meet established timeline (e.g. work with dispatch)
  • Make critical decisions (e.g. regarding exposure to H2S, equipment limits)
  • Carry out detailed procedures (e.g. set of steps to follow
  • Meet safety standards and company Core Values
  • Interact with other operators/supervisors
  • Maintain all AECOM tools and equipment to the required standards
  • Drive safely and professionally, obeying all traffic rules at all times
  • Participate fully in such things as job observations, near miss and HID reporting, site inspections, weekly and monthly safety meetings, and tailgate meetings
  • Identify and mitigate safety hazards
  • Understand and utilize the right and responsibility to stop unsafe work
  • Seek out continuous improvement opportunities
  • Provide customer-focused services in all activities
  • Foster a cooperative and positive work atmosphere


Minimum Requirements

CSTS

Clean 3 Year Drivers Abstract and Non-Restricted Driver License

First Aid Certification

Fit Test


Preferred Requirements

Experience working in a heavy mining environment
Experience driving haul trucks in a open pit mine environment (793 & 797 haul truck)
Ability to work both night shift and day shift
Dependable, reliable, positive personality and attitude


COVID Requirements:
This is a fly-in/fly-out position and as such will be subject to the Government of Canada’s mandatory COVID-19 vaccination requirements:

Effective October 30, 2021 travelers departing from Canadian airports, and travelers on VIA Rail and Rocky Mountaineer trains, will be required to be fully vaccinated to travel.

This position is located at a client site with a mandatory vaccination policy. All workers must be Fully Vaccinated (2 shots + 14 days).


COME AND GET YOUR BOOTS DIRTY


With a significant presence in the construction, industrial maintenance, and turnaround sectors, Jardeg is the largest recruiter of skilled trades in Canada. In 2022 alone, we’ll be supporting over 10 million manhours of work and a peak headcount over 10,000.


If you’re a tradesperson working in Canada, our position across commercial, infrastructure, and industrial construction, plus maintenance and turnarounds means we have more than just a job for you. We have a lifetime of work.

description:
Reference Number :
LA VCVR 032022
Status :
Permanent - Full time
Job Category :
Train Operations
City :
VANCOUVER
Province :
British Columbia
Annual Salary / Hourly Rate :
30.41

1
Application Deadline: :
2022-05-17
Description :
Do you enjoy working outdoors and operating heavy duty equipment
Do you have a good mechanical aptitude and the capacity to work well under pressure
This opportunity could be suited for you



VIA Rail Canada Inc. Canada's national passenger rail service is currently seeking an adaptable and proactive team-player to fill a position on the team as a Locomotive Attendant working from our esteemed Vancouver Maintenance Centre location.

Day in a life as a Locomotive Attendant at VIA Rail
As a Locomotive Attendant you will be responsible for the safe movement of locomotives and train consists in and around the confines of the Vancouver Maintenance Center. You will also be asked to move equipment use industrial tools perform general cleaning/janitorial and other related duties.
You must be willing and able to work outdoors in all types of weather conditions.

The position is permanent (40 hours per week guaranteed) and the work schedule may vary (the schedule choice is based on seniority).
Candidates must be available to work on evenings and weekends and will get two (2) days off a week.

What is in it for you
Hourly salary $30.41/hour

Full benefits Dental medical (prescription glasses drug prescription) pension plan ride pass
5 personal days + vacations
Requirements :
Requirements
High School diploma
Ability to lift up to 50lbs and use industrial tools
Valid driver s license (Class 1 or 3 is an asset)
Having a proactive attitude and the ability to work well under pressure
Availability to work outdoors and to work during the evenings and weekends

Assets
Previous experience working in a railway environment or at a similar role
C.R.O.R. certification



VIA Rail thanks all applicants for their interest, however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. VIA Rail is an employment-equity employer and encourages all qualified candidates to apply. VIA Rail Canada is proud to be a military friendly employer.

title: newTrain Conductor
description:
The conductor will have to perform yard work such as switching cars, making or splitting up the trains, moving the cars, etc. The employee will be a member of a train crew that will perform work in the rail yards or travel to various locations with the train to service our clients.

Responsibilities:

The selected individual will perform the following functions:

  • Manages and controls the movements of the cars by using lantern, hand and/or flag signals or radio to indicate when to start, stop, back-up or set or release air brakes.
  • Operates track switches (visually checks switch condition and direction) to change the direction of the engine or cars within yard limits or on the main railway; may apply or release hand brakes to switch or perform other duties.
  • Apply and release hand breaks to perform movements.
  • Follows the lists of work, respecting the order of those cars on the train.
  • Prepares required daily reports and switch lists, manually or electronically.
  • Inspects the condition of the train.
  • Follows and complies with the various rules, railway safety procedure and standards of Transport Canada.
  • Interacts with the railway authorities.
  • Work safely.
  • Other related tasks.

General Requirements:

  • Must possess a high school diploma.
  • Have experience or is a qualified conductor (important asset).
  • Able to adapt to different situations: work schedule, being on call, over time, tasks to accomplish, etc.
  • Must be prepared to work in adverse weather conditions.
  • Must be prepared to work on call 24/7, weekends, shifts.

Other working conditions: Vacation, benefits and paid holidays are based on the company’s policies.

If considered for the position, a full background check will be required (physical, drug, criminal and references).

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $26.13-$35.53 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Casual dress

title: Quality Assurance Intern (Contract)
description:
Organization: Real Food for Real Kids

Website: www.rfrk.com

Location: East End of Toronto, ON

Job Title: Quality Assurance Intern

Shift: Full-Time Monday to Friday, 6:00am - 2:00pm

Duration: A minimum of 12 weeks

Compensation:

  • $18.00 per hour

Real Food for Real Kids (RFRK) is a growing company on a mission to make real food the standard rather than the exception.

A multiple award-winning company recognized for excellence and innovation, we’re a leading healthy catering company for child care centres, schools and camps. RFRK proudly serves nutritious meals and snacks to thousands of children throughout the Greater Toronto & Hamilton Area every day. We’ve also recently launched our Real Food Kitchen Delivery service (https://realfoodkitchen.ca/) to get our yummy food directly into households. Having recently received HACCP certification, we’re well poised for growth into new markets and planning for significant expansion over the coming years

Our Logistics team is looking for a fantastic person to join us as a Super Driver. If you like the sound of us so far, keep reading to see if you have the experience and skills needed for this rewarding role!

RFRK Values:

  • Put Health First
  • Find a Better Way
  • Trust & Team
  • Spread Good Energy
  • Authenticity
About the Role:

The Quality Assurance Technician (QAT) helps to document and maintain food safety and quality standards in the RFRK Kitchen. The QAT helps to prevent issues from occurring and ensures RFRK ships the best quality safe food. You are willing to share knowledge and make sure everyone is on the same page with new quality procedures. The QAT will work collaboratively, independently and must be self-motivated. This role works closely with Production, Supply Chain and Logistics, and Food Planning departments to ensure quality and standards are met. Food safety, security, and quality are the QAT’s biggest priorities

Some of the things you’ll get paid to do:

QA & HACCP

  • Work with the Quality Assurance Specialist to review and implement HACCP Prerequisites
  • Perform internal audits and report findings, including yet not limited to daily inspection, weekly facility sanitation checks, area temperature checks, data downloads (for example ovens), best before ingredient inspection and management ect.
  • Responsible for the collection and maintenance of CCP documents and ensuring their completion to the Quality specialists requirements. Including but not limited to: cooking & retherm temperatures, cooling temperatures and Perox fruit and veg wash.

Training

  • Train staff on new and existing food handling and HACCP Programs
  • Establish and maintain a sanitation training plan for new and existing employees in that department
  • Update the training records and maintain the training matrix for all production employees. The quality technician would also be responsible for monthly updates to production management informing them about the status of training gaps.

Other

  • Chemical store stock management under direction and with assistance from maintenance and procurement

  • Other tasks as required


About You

  • You must be enrolled is post secondary school, in a relevant program
  • Strong computer skills, including Microsoft Office and database
  • Food quality inspection, auditing and testing is preferred
  • Training in HACCP Food Safety Management Systems preferred

To apply, please upload your resumé and cover letter, including salary expectations, explaining why you’d be a great fit for this role!


Real Food for Real Kids is an equal opportunity employer. We strongly encourage applications from diverse backgrounds and communities. Real Food for Real Kids welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

No phone calls or emails, please. We’ll contact applicants that fit the bill, and invite them in for an interview.

Thanks for your interest in Real Food for Real Kids!

Copyright © 2022 Real Food for Real Kids, All rights reserved.

title: General Labourer (Will Train!)
description:
Here at Modern PURAIR® we are looking for enthusiastic, motivated, customer focused individuals to join our Technician Team as an "General Labourer". We offer great pay, great incentives, a fun, supportive work environment and thorough practical training. We are currently accepting full time applications. Experience in HVAC Cleaning is not required to apply for this job position, but is a great bonus.

In this role, you will be responsible for completing Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning Cleaning for our Residential and Commercial Client base. This includes, but is not limited too:
  • Arriving to work on-time and in uniform.
  • Selling the value of our exceptional service by cleaning furnaces and air ducts in commercial, and residential environments.
  • Maintaining the PURAIR Cleaning Code, and ensuring each and every customer is WOW’d
  • Interacting with customers in their homes and businesses, keeping the equipment and truck cleaning, following our proven systems, invoicing and transactions, and carrying the Modern PURAIR brand in the field.
  • Working evenings and weekends or as required on the VentBox Schedule.
  • Entering confined space when required for the cleaning process.
  • Using all company supplied tools.
  • Working with PURAIR Team Members on industrial, commercial, and residential appointments.
  • Using company iPhone and iPad to ensure all company procedures are followed
  • Being a face and advocate of the Modern PURAIR brand.
  • Handling of customer service issues and call backs.
  • Handling of closing invoices, paperwork, and payment history through the VentBox System.
  • Always giving 100% to ensure the Modern PURAIR Way is exemplified.
  • Completing all training provided by Modern PURAIR, including both hands on and online training


A successful candidate will:

  • Have a positive, motivated, energetic personality
  • Able to successfully work in both team/independent environments
  • Be dedicated to exceptional customer service
  • Have a clean driver abstract and be able to pass a criminal background check
  • Enjoy a supportive and competitive environment

This job pays up to $35/hr with Profit Sharing

title: newSeasonal Housekeeper - $19/hr
description:
**Please note that this position is located in Christina Lake, BC

Why Vacasa

We started with just one home and an idea: to bring homeowners and renters together with smart technology and caring local teams. Today, we're the largest full-service vacation rental company in North America thanks to the people who give us their best every day. You'll fit right in here if you're curious, entrepreneurial, and thrive in a rapid-growth environment.

Why Housekeeping at Vacasa

We take pride in our work, knowing our tireless efforts provide peace of mind. We're the vacation heroes—giving guests a spotless first impression and setting the tone for an unforgettable experience. With us, you're more than just a housekeeper, you're a keeper of the house.

What we're looking for

We're searching for an exceptional individual to join our team in Christina Lake, BC as a Housekeeper. This person is a hard-working individual who will embody our values while maintaining the supreme cleanliness of our homes.

Hours can and will vary weekly and seasonally based on business needs.

What you'll do

  • Professionally clean and maintain Vacasa properties using cleaning procedures and products in conformance with prescribed company standards
  • Sweeping, vacuuming, mopping, dusting, and washing all surfaces
  • Move all reasonably portable furniture in rooms to clean under and behind
  • Assist with laundry as needed
  • Create a welcoming environment for our guests and owners by ensuring homes are clean and cared for
  • Identify and note any damages to homes. Create maintenance tickets as necessary
  • Collect and remove trash and debris
  • Meet and maintain required Housekeeping metrics
  • Attend all mandatory individual and team meetings
  • Replenish consumable items such as soaps and paper products
  • Maintain hot tubs as needed; no experience necessary - we offer on-site training
  • Other responsibilities as assigned - because every day looks different

The skills you'll need and position requirements

  • Reliable transportation
  • Smartphone and personal email address
  • Weekend availability
  • Attention to detail
  • No experience required, we're happy to train you!
  • Ability to stand for extended periods of time, bend, stoop, squat, kneel and lift over 20 pounds

Compensation:

  • $19/hr

What you'll get

  • Mileage Reimbursement
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Career advancement opportunities
  • Employee discounts
  • All the equipment you'll need to be successful
  • Great colleagues and culture
  • $500 Retention Bonus

Vacasa is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We do not discriminate against applicants based upon race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, or other classes protected by applicable law. Veterans are encouraged.

Vacasa is committed to maintaining a safe and productive work environment. Possession, use, or being under the influence of alcohol or illegal drugs in the workplace is prohibited.

Some positions may require that you drive a personal vehicle and/or company vehicle for work purposes. Employees who are required to drive a personal vehicle must have reliable transportation, a valid driver's license, and be at least 18 years of age. Employees who are required to drive a company vehicle must have a valid driver's license, be at least 21 years of age, and have been a licensed driver for no less than 3 years.

An offer of employment for this role will be contingent upon the successful completion of a background check.

title: newField Technician
description:
Company Description
Focal Systems is the industry leader in retail AI solutions. We are a Silicon Valley-based startup that has more than doubled in size every year since our founding. Our mission is to automate and optimize brick and mortar retail using deep learning computer vision. Focal has been deployed at scale with the top retailers in the world. We are looking for smart, creative, and passionate people who love to learn, enjoy thinking critically, share our values, and want to build a great and enduring company.

We have built the next-generation operating system for brick & mortar retail. This OS leverages shelf-mounted cameras that constantly measure the state of the retailers’ shelves and use that information to order quicker and smarter, planogram better, and schedule, direct, train and manage their staff. We have proven this with major retailers around the world.

Job Description
We are currently expanding our operations throughout Canada. We are looking for a Field Technician / Team Lead who can lead and champion deployments for our first customers in your area. This role will have overall accountability for the successful deployment, maintenance, and adoption of our system. This is a part-time position working flex hours with a path to a full-time position.

Responsibilities
Overall accountability for deployment, training, and customer success
Supervision of Field Technicians and contractors
Troubleshooting and quality control
Onboarding/scanning products into the system
Routine stops at our client locations for battery swaps and diagnostics
Onsite and offsite maintenance
Learn to build devices and deploy them
Dynamic oversight of services and operations
Serve as a primary point of contact reporting anything relevant in the field back to our Product Team

Requirements
1+ years experience as a Field Service Technician
Proven team lead or supervisory experience
Organized, detail-oriented, dependable, and self-sufficient
Strong customer service orientation
Interested in technology
Thrive in a fast-paced environment
Flexible with your schedule, including nights and weekends
Must have a valid driver's license and ownership of a reliable vehicle
Must have a working smartphone (Android or iPhone)

Why Focal Systems
Strong Mission and Values
We are a tightly-knit team with an ambitious mission and a strong set of core values, which define our approach to business and have successfully guided us since inception.

Exceptional Team
We are a team of hard-working, fun-loving professionals from some of the most eminent universities, research labs, and tech companies of our time. We pride ourselves on recruiting exceptional individuals to help us redefine the state-of-the-art.

Outstanding Partners
We work with 10+ of the largest retailers in the world and have a world-class roster of investors, advisors and partners to support & advise us in our endeavors.

Benefits
Paid Time Off & Sick Time

Expected start date: 2021-09-14

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Temporary, Permanent

Pay: $22.00 per hour

Application question(s):

  • Please respond with your availability for a 20-minute phone interview today or later this week with the best number to reach you.

Licence/Certification:

  • driver's license (preferred)
