title: Lead Housekeeper
description:
**Please note that this position is located in Big White, BC.

****$500 BONUS OPPORTUNITY**** (paid in 2 parts)

Why Vacasa

We started with just one home and an idea: to bring homeowners and renters together with smart technology and caring local teams. Today, we're the largest full-service vacation rental company in North America thanks to the people who give us their best every day. You'll fit right in here if you're curious, entrepreneurial, and thrive in a rapid-growth environment.

Why Housekeeping at Vacasa

We take pride in our work, knowing our tireless efforts provide peace of mind. We're the vacation heroes—giving guests a spotless first impression and setting the tone for an unforgettable experience. With us, you're more than just a housekeeper, you're a keeper of the house.

What we're looking for

We're searching for an exceptional individual to join our team as a Lead Housekeeper. This person is a hard-working individual who will embody our values while maintaining the supreme cleanliness of our homes. This person will manage a small group of housekeepers in Big White, BC and work closely with the local management team.

While this position is considered part-time, you may have the opportunity to obtain full-time employment based on your skill set and the company's growth. Hours can and will vary weekly and seasonally based on business needs.

What you'll do

  • Professionally clean and maintain Vacasa properties using cleaning procedures and products in conformance with prescribed company standards
    • Sweeping, vacuuming, mopping, dusting, and washing all surfaces
    • Move all reasonably portable furniture in rooms to clean under and behind
    • Assist with laundry as needed
  • Create a welcoming environment for our guests and owners by ensuring homes are clean and cared for
  • Assist with scheduling, distribution of tickets, ordering and organizing supplies, as assigned by the manager
  • Provide input on performance evaluations, resolving problems, and implementing disciplinary action with assistance from your manager and Human Resources
  • Identify and note any damages to homes. Create maintenance tickets as necessary
  • Manage, mentor, train, and support a small group of Housekeepers
  • Ensure the housekeeping staff follows through on assignments and provide guidance on work methods and routines such as follow the wall, standard unit of appearance, and reporting damage.
  • Perform inspections of cleans completed by Housekeepers
    • Touch-up cleans as needed
  • Establish and maintain open, collaborative relationships with team members and management team
    • Correspond on a regular basis with your local management team and team members
    • Be available and willing to assist your colleagues and management team when necessary
  • Provide cross-coverage for your manager and Co-Lead Housekeeper(s) when necessary
  • Collect and remove trash and debris
  • Meet and maintain required Housekeeping metrics
  • Attend all mandatory individual and team meetings
  • Replenish consumable items such as soaps and paper products
  • Other responsibilities as assigned - because every day looks different

The skills you'll need

  • Reliable transportation/Valid B.C. Drivers License
  • Smartphone and personal email address
  • Driving inclement weather conditions as required
  • Availability to work Sunday through Saturday, early mornings and evenings as needed.
  • Ability to work well under pressure in a fast-paced environment
  • Lead by example while embodying our company values
  • Highly responsive and reliable
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Prior housekeeping experience preferred although we can teach you the Vacasa standard
  • Ability to stand, sit, and walk for an extended period of time.
    • Reach overhead and below the waist
    • Push, pull, and lift less than or equal to 20 pounds
    • Bend, stoop, squat, kneel, and twist
  • Adhere to all company policies and procedures
  • Reasonable comfort level with computers and smart devices
    • Access to the internet and the ability to check your email on a daily basis

Compensation

  • $23.50/hr

What you'll get

  • Extended Medical and Dental
  • Registered Retirement Savings Plan - company match
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Career advancement opportunities
  • Employee discounts
  • All the equipment you'll need to be successful
  • Great colleagues and culture
  • $500 sign-on bonus paid in 2 parts

Vacasa is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We do not discriminate against applicants based upon race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, or other classes protected by applicable law. Veterans are encouraged.

Vacasa is committed to maintaining a safe and productive work environment. Possession, use, or being under the influence of alcohol or illegal drugs in the workplace is prohibited.

Some positions may require that you drive a personal vehicle and/or company vehicle for work purposes. Employees who are required to drive a personal vehicle must have reliable transportation, a valid driver's license, and be at least 18 years of age. Employees who are required to drive a company vehicle must have a valid driver's license, be at least 21 years of age, and have been a licensed driver for no less than 3 years.

An offer of employment for this role will be contingent upon the successful completion of a background check.

Show more

title: Home Instruction for Parents of Pre-school Youngsters (HIPPY) Coordinator
description:
Home Instruction for Parents of Pre-school Youngsters (HIPPY) Coordinator

Alberta Immigrant Women & Children Centre is a registered charitable organization in Edmonton, Alberta. AIWCC, assist and provide support to women and children in need. We recognize, respond to, and focus on the specific concerns of immigrant and refugee women and their families.

The HIPPY Program engages families and children aged 3 year- 5 years in early childhood literacy and school readiness. It’s an early childhood enrichment program which works with parents of young children with a focus working with isolated and disadvantaged newcomer’s communities. HIPPY uses a peer education model to deliver a structed one on one home visiting program and regular HIPPY events, which provide parents, with skills, recourses, and materials to prepare their children for school and support the transition to schools.

Educational Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in early childhood, elementary, family, or adult education, social work, or any other related field.

Other Qualifications:

  • Strong training and leadership skills
  • Strong oral and written communication skills
  • Strong background in project/program management
  • Demonstrated knowledge of and sensitivity to the needs and interests of newcomer families
  • Willingness to work as part of a team
  • Demonstrated administrative and organizational skills
  • Good computer skills
  • Prior experience in one or more of the following areas is an asset: educational administration, community mobilization, parent empowerment / family support, child/family advocacy or staff development

Responsibilities:

After successful completion of the pre-service training seminar, the HIPPY Coordinator has a responsibility for:

  • Carrying out the HIPPY program in accordance with the terms of the contract
  • Recruitment and selection of eligible HIPPY families and home visitor staff
  • Ongoing supervision and training of Home Visitors, which may include the planning and execution of a staff development plan
  • Making occasional home visits
  • Planning and holding monthly group meetings that include role playing
  • Data entry for statistical purposes
  • Establishing effective partnerships with other human service organizations in order to ensure quality service delivery to participating families
  • Participation in regional and national HIPPY conferences, in-service training, and meetings.
  • Ensure weekly home visits and regular HIPPY events are facilitated in a timely and comprehensive manner
  • Coordinate annual HIPPY graduation ceremony
  • Maintain and continue to develop appropriate and organized administrative system, including regular reporting, data, and issues documentation
  • Effective use of computers for word processing, spreadsheets, data entry and promotional materials
  • Maintain accurate HIPPY delivery visits record, forms and statistical information.
  • Ensure all the data and reporting requirements for HIPPY Edmonton are submitted in accordance with specified timelines.
  • Ensure quarterly compliance data in entered into ETO Online Data Management System.
  • Use principles of best practice to provide an innovative and responsive program.
  • Use continual improvement approach to review and evaluate the program and practices.
  • Comply with organizational effectiveness strategies for the HIPPY Program including participation in review and planning visits with the funding agency.
  • Co-operate with current research projects and participate in additional research and evaluation as required.
  • Recruit, train, and support HIPPY Home Visitors to deliver the program.
  • Facilitate weekly HIPPY Training & Enrichment sessions.
  • Build capacity within HIPPY Home Visitors, with the aim of supporting longer term career opportunities.
  • Establish, lead, coach and inspire an engaged and productive team.
  • Provide support, guidance, coaching, leadership, and empowerment to the team including feedback through performance reviews and regular supervision.
  • Undertake regular supervision and performance review with the program manager, providing feedback to promote collaborative working relationships.
  • Promote and maintain a positive, respectful, and enthusiastic work environment
  • Attend mandatory trainings and meeting sessions.
  • The successful candidate must have a driver's license and access to a vehicle.
  • Valid criminal records check.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $26.00-$29.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Edmonton, AB T5A 1C6: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Application deadline: 2022-06-25
Expected start date: 2022-07-04

Show more

title: Train Testing Driver
description:
Why join us?

SNC-Lavalin provides cutting-edge engineering, procurement, construction and financing solutions to projects in more than 100 countries around the world. From the Canadian Arctic to the Southern African region and Australasia, our multicultural workforce is driven by a fierce pride in their work and a pioneering vision.

SNC-Lavalin is truly a global leader in its field and has been chosen to design and build some of the most prestigious projects in the world.

How will you contribute to the team?

To perform this role successfully, the candidate will be responsible for but not limited to the following:

  • Drive trains, hi rail equipment and light vehicles either in cabs or with remote controls.
  • Assist in developing the daily schedules.
  • Follow Driver checklist for Train pre use inspections based on Supplier.
  • Understand and support maintenance work happening on the tracks they drive on, and any rule changes.
  • Operate points (levers that switch tracks).
  • communicate with train control, other drivers and shunters, and track level workers.
  • prepare and write Step Backs for job site safety following Project processes.
  • act promptly and comply with safety rules during emergencies or breakdowns.
  • identify and report faults and assist the supplier technicians in repairing faults with their equipment.
  • Provide snow removal along tracks, stations and work areas within the Yard and Mainline.
  • Wear, use and maintain PPE needed for all conditions and jobs assigned.

What will you contribute?

Skills and knowledge -

Train drivers need to have knowledge of:

  • Minimum 2 years relevant experience.
  • Emergency and safety procedures and first aid.
  • How to operate an LRV and its mechanics, including air brakes and electrics.
  • Rail-operating codes and signals.
  • Safety rules and regulations.
  • The correct way to use radio equipment.
  • Shunting (pushing and pulling trains).

Working conditions -

Train drivers:

  • Do shift work, including nights, weekends and public holidays.
  • Work in drivers' cabs, outside in railway yards, and on train tracks in all weather and light conditions.
  • Work in conditions that are inherently hazardous (because they work with large machinery), and sometimes stressful (because there is a risk of hitting cars, animals or people on the tracks).
  • Working outside, day or night, in all weather conditions.

What we offer at SNC-Lavalin?

At SNC-Lavalin, you will enjoy good compensation, a safe and healthy work environment, and a full range of benefits (ie.: group insurance, retirement savings plan, share purchase plan, continuing education program, etc.).

  • Opportunity to work on various projects of various sizes.
  • Competitive salary.
  • Motivational financial package & flexible benefits.
  • Defined contribution pension plan in which SNC-Lavalin contributes.
  • Work equipment provided according to the season (boot, bib, helmet, gloves, etc.).
  • Employee Share Ownership Plan (ESOP).
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP).
  • Learning and Development programs, training, career opportunities.

Additional Information:

Appropriate accommodations will be provided upon request throughout the recruitment and hiring process as required by Company policy and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA).

Successful applicants will be notified about SNC-Lavalin’s accommodation policies at the time the employment offer is extended, and the information will be shared with new personnel during the onboarding process.

At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.

SNC-Lavalin cares about your privacy. SNC-Lavalin and other subsidiary or affiliated companies of SNC-Lavalin (referred to throughout as “SNC-Lavalin”) are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice on our Careers site to know more about how we collect, use and transfer your Personal Data.

By submitting your personal information to SNC-Lavalin, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

Founded in 1911, SNC-Lavalin is a global fully integrated professional services and project management company and a major player in the ownership of infrastructure. From offices around the world, SNC-Lavalin's employees are proud to build what matters. Our teams provide comprehensive end-to-end project solutions – including capital investment, consulting, design, engineering, construction, sustaining capital and operations and maintenance – to clients in oil and gas, mining and metallurgy, infrastructure and power. On July 3, 2017, SNC-Lavalin acquired Atkins, one of the world's most respected design, engineering and project management consultancies. https://www.snclavalin.com

Show more

title: Bus Cleaner / Wash Bay Attendant
description:
Wash Bay Attendant - Temporary

PWTransit is currently seeking a temporary Bus Cleaner / Wash Bay Attendant to join our team in Leduc. This position would be temporary for 4-6 weeks with the possibility of extension and the opportunity to train as a driver. The Wash Bay Attendant is responsible for cleaning both the interior and exterior of PWTransit’s fleet of buses and light duty vehicles. Leduc residents are preferred.

Qualifications:

  • Minimum Class 4 driver's license required
  • Experience driving commercial vehicles considered an asset
  • Clear driver's abstract
  • Previous vehicle detailing and / or bus operator experience considered an asset

Position Details: ​

  • Paid training provided at $18.70/hour; regular rate of $21.96/hour after training
  • Monday to Friday schedule; 7 hours per day

Responsibilities:

  • Clean the interior and exterior of various vehicles as determined by the Company
  • Clean the bus advertising and back-lit lighting, report any interior lights that are not working
  • Replace interior and exterior advertising signs when required
  • May be required to pre-trip a spare bus
  • Cleaning undercarriages, wheels and vehicle parts
  • Miscellaneous building cleaning duties, dumping trashcans and washing floors when assigned
  • Keep cleaning supplies up to date by requesting items from Management
  • May be assigned incidental tasks of a janitorial nature or general clean up and painting duties that are commonly associated with the operation of a maintenance center and bus parking/servicing garage
  • Spare driving duties as required

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $21.96 per hour

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

description:
Other Languages

  • Spanish; Castilian

Number of Tours Guided

  • 10 tours and +

Geographical Areas of Specialization

  • Canada

Credentials (certificates, licences, memberships, courses, etc.)

  • First Aid Certificate
  • CPR Certificate

Additional Skills

  • Drive sightseeing or tour vehicle

Type of Guide

  • Step-on local guide
  • On-site local guide
  • Meet and greet local guide
  • Escorted group travel guide
  • Escorted individual travel guide
  • Driver-guide, local

Tours Focus

  • Co-ordinate activities with local tour guides or leaders of performance groups
  • Assist clients/guests with special needs
  • Collect administration or entrance fees
  • Transport or escort individuals or groups on tours of cities, waterways and industrial and other establishments
  • Conduct guided tours of museums, gallery exhibitions and historical, heritage and other sites, answer inquiries and provide information

Security and Safety

  • Willing to travel regularly
  • Willing to travel cross-border
  • Willing to travel for extended periods
  • Willing to travel overnight

title: Driver
description:
Do you possess EXCELLENT CLIENT SERVICE skills?

Do you understand the importance of TIMELY deliveries?

Are you a SAFETY CONSCIOUS individual?


For over 60 years, Manderley has been passionate about creating living green space for beautiful, healthy communities by providing high quality, innovative lawn and garden products. We’re Canada's largest sod producer and leaders in the landscape industry, but still have a small, family-feel. We believe that the success of our company and high employee satisfaction comes from great teamwork, ensuring everyone has an opportunity to contribute, be heard, learn new skills, and have fun. If you’re someone who enjoys a challenge, who’s driven to solve problems and brings a positive attitude to the table, you’ll fit right in at Manderley.


For more information on our company, our products and our culture, visit www.manderley.com/careers


Based in Edmonton, you are customer service focused and professional when providing local deliveries to our clients. Drivers can wok 40–70-hour work weeks and occasional weekends in our peak season. Drivers may be required to use automated routing equipment. Truck Drivers require commercial drivers' license.


Truck can encounter all kinds of road, weather, and traffic conditions. The number of hours a driver may drive in a given period is subject to regulation.


Compensation is hourly rate of $30, plus overtime, potential for bonuses, and contribution into a seasonal health plan.


Core Competencies


  • Quality Orientation
  • Time Management
  • Accountability and Dependability
  • Decision making and Judgement
  • Operating Equipment
  • Ethics and Integrity
  • Planning and Organizing
  • Communication

Job Duties


  • Deliveries for retail and commercial clients
  • Perform trip inspections on equipment operated and load, ensuring safety and roadworthiness
  • Comply with applicable legislation including safe operation, carriage of goods, driver's hours of service, occupational health and safety
  • Check vehicles before driving them to ensure that mechanical, safety, and emergency equipment is in good working order.
  • Report vehicle defects, accidents, traffic violations, or damage to the vehicles.
  • Maintain electronic logs of working hours and of vehicle service and repair status
  • Record and maintain required documentation including driver logbook, bills of lading, etc. by manual or electronic means
  • Assist in loading and unloading of trucks, including tarping and strapping of load
  • Deliver to product and proper paperwork to our customers in a courteous and timely manner
  • Operate transport and loaders in a safe manner
  • Use Smart Phone to capture delivery information


Requirements


  • 3+ years’ experience driving transports
  • Class 1 license
  • Must provide a 3-year driver abstract
  • B-train experience and forklift certification an asset
  • Positive attitude and strong communication skills
  • Must be able to work with little supervision; must be self-directed

Work Conditions


  • Travel required
  • Will be required to work both indoors and outdoors
  • Overtime as required
  • Weekend work may be required
  • Ability to lift 50 pounds

If you are an experienced driver that is customer focused and enjoys driving newer equipment, we want to hear from you!


Manderley welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request of candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.


Send resume to careers@manderley.com


At Manderley we are a Team. We support one another and work together to succeed.


We are committed to customer service excellence! Manderley produces, distributes, and sells quality sod & landscape products to commercial and retail customers nationally.

Show more

title: $5,000 SIGNING BONUS & RELOCATION ASSISTANCE AVAILABLE** Train Conductor - Revelstoke
description:
COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement: Pursuant to the Government of Canada's mandate that all federally-regulated employers require their employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, CP requires all prospective employees to confirm their vaccination status, or have an approved Transport Canada exemption, as part of the hiring process and as a condition of continued employment.


NEW HIRE CONDUCTORS WILL RECEIVE A $5,000 SIGNING BONUS AND RELOCATION ASSISTANCE!! (must commit to working for CP for one year or the signing bonus and relocation bonus will be repayable). Current and previous Canadian Pacific employees are not eligible to receive the signing bonus)


Earn $85,000 in your first year working as a qualified conductor. The average conductor earns approximately $107,000 annually, with the ability to make up to $140,000.


  • Req ID: 88784
  • Department: Operations Pacific Division
  • Job Type: Full-Time
  • Position Type: Union
  • Location: Revelstoke, British Columbia
  • Country: Canada
  • Job Available to: Internal & External
  • Deadline to apply: 05/31/2022

Conductor Training Class - No Experience Required!


**We are currently collecting resumes for current and future openings in 2022**



This is an exciting opportunity to join CP in an entry level Railroading position, where no previous railroad experience is required. We provide 16 weeks of paid training. Other exciting benefits you can expect are a Defined Benefit Pension Plan, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Tuition Reimbursement Program and more!


This is a Safety Critical position, which will require pre-employment checks that can take multiple weeks to complete once successfully selected. For transparency in the recruitment process (9-12 weeks), the steps in the recruitment process include:



1. Collect and gather applicants (2-3 weeks)
2. Screen and interview candidates (2-3 weeks)
3. Criminal, Drug and Medical Clearances (3-4 weeks)
4. Notice period for new hires to current employers (2-3 weeks)


To see the if the Conductor position is a good fit for you, please complete this Realist Job Preview prior to applying: https://www.cpconductor.rjp.cdglhosting.com/


Canadian Pacific is a transcontinental railway in Canada and the United States with direct links to major ports on the west and east coasts. CP provides North American customers a competitive rail service with access to key markets in every corner of the globe. CP is growing with its customers, offering a suite of freight transportation services, logistics solutions and supply chain expertise. Visit cpr.ca to see the rail advantages of CP. For more on our purpose, culture, and strategy, visit cpr.ca/en/about-cp.


POSITION DESCRIPTION:

Are you looking for an exciting career? Becoming a Train Conductor is the perfect career for you! As a Train Conductor you will start your rewarding long term career at CP.


As a Train Conductor you will work as a member of a train crew that will assist with switching cars, making or splitting up trains in yards, or moving cars between yards, sidings or tracks;


POSITION ACCOUNTABILITIES:

  • Work in either train or yard service depending on their seniority;
  • Carry out specific instructions detailing a train's route and specific movements;
  • Handle the switching of cars, including coupling and uncoupling cars, and is able to lift out coupling device;
  • Observe, interpret, and relay signals and other indications affecting movement of train;
  • Signal crew members for movement of the engine or train using specific signals, or radio to indicate when to start, stop, back-up, set or release air brakes;
  • Provide flag protection and relays signals to trains in an emergency situation, as stipulated in the operating rules;
  • Move on and off moving or stationary equipment while train is performing industrial, station, or yard switching;
  • Ride moving car by hanging onto grab irons or ladder, sometimes for extended periods of time;
  • Fill out forms including train orders and switch lists and prepares required clear and legible reports;
  • Work irregular hours, including holidays, weekends, days and nights and for periods of time up to 12 hours;
  • Must be constantly alert to changing conditions and events and take safe and responsible action as required.

POSITION REQUIREMENTS:

  • High School Graduation or General Equivalency Diploma (GED);
  • 3 to 5 years’ work experience with a demonstrated safe work record;
  • Valid driver's license is required;
  • Must be at least 18 years old;
  • Demonstrated mechanical aptitude;
  • Must be able to work with minimal supervision;
  • Able to take action and/or make decisions affecting security/well-being of others, i.e. alerting others to unsafe conditions;
  • Must have good spatial ability with regard to a sense of layout and space, together with an ability to judge speed and/or distance of moving objects;
  • Able to communicate effectively both oral and in written;
  • Good interpersonal skills with the ability to operate as a contributing member of a team;
  • Must be prepared to work weekends and shifts - on call 24 hours/day with 2 Hours’ notice depending on location, (with exception of Annual Vacation);
  • Work may require extended time away from home;
  • Must be able to pass the required examinations, read and understand safety instructions, books of rules, instructions and regulations, timetables, bulletins, waybills, placards, and other written or printed material;
  • Must be prepared to work in adverse weather conditions;
  • May be required to lift up to 80 lbs.
  • Must be able to cross the United States border for work purposes;
  • Must be able to obtain a passport.

WHAT CP HAS TO OFFER:

  • Competitive benefits package
  • Competitive company pension plan
  • Annual Fitness Subsidy

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:


Medical Requirements:

Operating safely is a core foundation of CP. Our commitment is to protect our people, customers, communities in which we operate, the environment and our assets. We are also committed to a healthy and safe workplace. CP’s Alcohol and Drug Policy and Procedures (“Policy and Procedures”) support these commitments. All new hires for a safety critical position will be required to complete a pre-employment medical that includes a physical, vision, hearing, alcohol and drug audit assessment. Pre-employment qualification drug test(s) are also required. This includes candidates participating in the Trainee Program who will also be required to pass a drug test during the training process before receiving final qualification for the position.


Background Investigation:

The successful candidate will need to successfully complete the following clearances:

  • Criminal history check
  • Reference check
  • Education verification
  • Driver's License Verification

CP is an equal opportunity employer committed to the principles of employment equity and inclusion. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals. All applicant information will be managed in accordance with the federal Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act ("PIPEDA").

Show more

title: Centrifuge and Dredging Technician
description:
Taber Solids Control (1998) LTD. is an Alberta locally owned and operated Centrifuge and Dredging company, providing environmental solutions to the oilfield, municipal and industrial industries. For over 32 years Taber Solids Control has been dedicated to customer service and satisfaction and as such, safety of our employees is our top priority.

Position Overview:

We have an exciting opportunity for the right candidate to join our team and work out of our Edmonton facility (and work in the field at our clients’ sites). Day to day duties would include assisting around the shop, assisting and leading some of the repair and maintenance work of our field equipment, field duties around rig-ups and rig-out’s, day to day preventive maintenance on all company owned equipment and some sit in field projects.

Position Requirements:

The Centrifuge & Dredging Technician will:

· Work out of the Edmonton facility shop Monday to Friday (from 8AM to 5PM) for duties (with the addition of out-of-town work as required)

· Have a valid Alberta (or equivalent) Class 5 drivers license with a reasonable abstract required for hire

· Be able to successfully pass pre-access drug testing (as required for client site work)

· Have drilling rig and dredging experience (but we will train the right applicant)

· Be able to work around wastewater safely and confidently

· Be able to work away from our Edmonton facility for extended periods of time

· Perform troubleshooting and repair activities

· Have some basic electrical knowledge

· Regularly attend and actively participate in safety meetings (including identifying any hazards or risks, reporting all concerns to management, and assisting with the safety and worksite investigations)

· Perform mechanical and or equipment maintenance as required

· Maintain safe and clean equipment (in a ready-to-use state) and keep a clean personal work site

· Acquire and maintains all certifications as required (H2S Awareness, First Aid, etc.) Taber Solids Control will provide certification for the right candidate

· Have the able to occasionally work by yourself safely

Position Benefits:

Taber Solids Control offers a very competitive, all-inclusive benefit package after successfully completing your 3-month probationary period. Your benefit package includes:

  • Comprehensive extended health care and dental coverage
  • A competitive vacation & personal paid time off plan
  • Life insurance coverage
  • Vision care coverage
  • Paid training

We’re looking to add to our already stellar team of employees. If you’re looking to start with a company that has a strong focus on growth and development, safety and offering top service to clients – this would be the position for you.

In addition to a great compensation and benefit package – Taber Solids Control focuses on professional development and growth. Come work with a company that’s focused on growing YOU. Apply today – we thank everyone for their application but only the shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $68,000.00-$100,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
Taber Solids Control has a comprehensive COVID-19 employee safety plan in place.

Application question(s):

  • Do you have a safe and reliable vehicle to drive to and from our Edmonton facility?
  • Are you aware that this position is located in Edmonton and requires occasional travel to other parts of Western Canada?

Experience:

  • oil and gas: 3 years (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • First Aid & CPR (preferred)
  • H2S Alive (preferred)
  • Class 5 Licence (preferred)

Willingness to travel:

  • 25% (preferred)

title: Mixer Driver
description:
Excellence. Integrity. Passion.

BURNCO is currently hiring full-time and part-time experienced professional drivers with their class 1 or 3 CDL to train/work as Mixer Drivers for our Edmonton, Alberta Ready-Mix Division. Reporting to the Driver Supervisor, the successful candidates will support our business by providing exceptional customer service through concrete delivery and pouring while developing positive relationships with customers. If you are energetic, highly motivated, an effective communicator, and possess strong interpersonal and leadership skills, come work for a great Alberta company and earn yourself above average pay driving our well-maintained trucks. Apply Now!

We offer that, great benefits and more:

  • Competitive Compensation with Increases
  • Company 6% RRSP Matching Program
  • Comprehensive Health Benefits
  • High Quality Individuals and Teams
  • Strong Safety Culture
  • Enjoy the Benefits of Working With A Reputable, Stable and Growing Company
  • Be part of the team building legacy infrastructure that will be around for generations (You can say I built that!)

What You Will Be Doing

Location: 3867-92 Ave NW Edmonton, Alberta

  • Operating a Ready-Mix truck in urban areas and tight construction sites
  • Performing routine equipment maintenance
  • Contributing to keeping locations in and around the plant clean and hazardous free
  • Learning our company safety protocol in order to execute work safely

Requirements

What We Would Like From You

  • Class 1 or 3 CDL (w/ air brake endorsement)
  • Clean Drivers Abstract
  • Concrete Mixer truck driving experience preferred
  • Must be mechanically inclined
  • City driving experience
  • The ability to drive standard or manual transmission
  • Ability to work flexible hours including weekends, and be available on short notice
  • Ability to successfully pass our pre-employment testing

IMPORTANT: As a safety sensitive position, it is a condition of employment that selected candidate successfully pass comprehensive pre-employment testing that includes a Background Check, a Drug and Alcohol screen and Fitness to Work testing. Please note that we have a zero tolerance policy for any Cannabis derived products regardless of use frequency or purpose. Candidate hired will also be subject to BURNCO's COVID vaccination policy that may be in effect at the time.

Since 1912, BURNCO has been supplying aggregate construction materials as a successful, family-run business based in Calgary. Over the last 110 years we have embraced innovative technology and new marketplaces while always maintaining the vision and values that were first introduced by our founder, James F. Burns. Today we continue our unwavering commitment to safety, our renewed focus on family leadership and our steady, dependable growth into the future. We look forward to having you join us on that journey.


Posting Updated: 4/14/2022

Posting Open Until Filled

#BRPH

#LI-BD1

title: Branch Driver
description:
Company Description


A growing company with a fixed work schedule? No more having to sacrifice personal time for work? A competitive wage and benefits package? If these things peak your interest then Gentek Building Products is the company for you!

At Gentek Building Products, we pride ourselves on the superior customer service experience that we provide to our clients. We recognize that this can only be achieved by having a fantastic group of employees and, as a result, we are committed to taking the time and effort needed to thoroughly train all employees!


What's In It For You?

  • Competitive hourly wage ($25.00+)
  • Competitive benefits package
  • Savings plan with company matched contributions

Job Description


Our busy distribution branch in Sudbury, ON requires a AZ Truck Driver to make deliveries to our customers and job sites while providing great customer service. As a branch driver, you will be required to exert physical effort and handling of heavy products, but we promise to give you lots of time to regroup with an awesome work-life balance! When not on deliveries, you will be a valued member of our warehouse team, helping with the accurate shipping and receiving of product.

Responsibilities:

  • Safely load and unload product using the appropriate equipment.
  • Know our product and your route. We value our customer(s) time – we get it right the first time.
  • Know our customers. Greet and assist them in a friendly and efficient manner.

Qualifications


Qualifications:

  • Have a valid AZ drivers license
  • Are dependable and cooperative
  • Have the ability and willingness to perform heavy lifting required for loading/unloading
  • Attentive and detail oriented
  • You are cooperative and reliable. You’ll come to work and give us your best every day.
  • You are compliant. You will follow all safety rules without exception.

Additional Information


Gentek is growing. Come grow with us. The people at Gentek are the difference. If you are interested in joining our team please respond with cover letter and resume.

Accommodations for applicants with disability available upon request.

#Indeed2 - Gentek

title: AZ Truck Driver : Ottawa, ON ($27.00 per hour)
description:
**This position is based out of our resident yard in Ottawa**


Are you an AZ driver who is committed to safety and delivering exceptional customer service? If so, Tim Hortons Distribution may just be the place for you! As a certified Great Place to Work, we can confidently say you'll be joining a team of dedicated, professional Drivers who have a passion for our iconic brand. At Tim Hortons Distribution, we understand the importance of work/life balance, which is why as a Driver, you will typically work 4 days a week and know your schedule well in advance.


What's in it for you:

  • Competitive base hourly wage
  • Overtime is paid after 80 hrs. biweekly
  • Immediate company paid Benefits for you and your family
  • Annual Performance Bonus
  • 3 weeks of paid vacation per year
  • Pension plan with Company contributions
  • Immediate RRSP/TFSA options
  • Employee Shares Purchase Plan
  • Annual safety boot allowance
  • Annual uniform allotment
  • Employee Product Purchase Program
  • Majority of local runs meaning you are home at the end of your shift
  • Top of the line equipment
  • Power tail gates
  • Power driver walkies
  • Onboard computers
  • 24-hour office support from transportation supervisor

What we do:

Our drivers safely deliver dry and temperature-controlled products to approximately 1500 Tim Hortons restaurants. We operate 7 days per week nearly 24 hours per day using a variety of trailer sizes to meet delivery demands and constraints.


On the Job:

  • Offloading products using a powered tailgate and powered driver walkie
  • Verifying order accuracy and assisting store employees with bringing the products into the restaurant
  • Providing outstanding customer service and support to restaurant employees
  • Performing Pre and Post trip inspections
  • Completing all appropriate regulatory and Company documentation
  • Safely and professionally operating Company equipment at all times
  • Ensuring food safety and food defense standards are followed
  • Other duties as assigned

Required Skills:

  • Valid AZ driver's license and at least 1 year of experience operating AZ vehicles
  • Clean driver's abstract and CVOR
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (Both verbal and written)
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs
  • Proven track record of reliability and safety
  • Ability to work in a all types of weather and road conditions
  • Lift truck experience is preferred
  • B-Train experience is preferred
  • Flexibility to work days or nights

Driver schedules include a variety of departure times and some weekend work.

Show more

title: Calgary Area Fire Safety Advisors
description:
We are a global fire safety company with newly opened locations in Western Canada.

Business of saving lives through the finest fire protection is very rewarding and easy.

We are looking for those that love helping others and appreciate being a part of a team in Calgary. We also appreciate those that are ambitious for personal growth as we have on-going training available from around the globe.

Looking for sharp individuals for several key positions in our fire safety team including but not limited to: FT manager, FT trainer, PT trainer, marketing (call centre) manager, FT sales reps, and PT sales reps.

Previous sales, training, and management experience will help to fast-track process for advancement as we will only have to train on product knowledge and company structure. Will make exception for ambitious, hard-working, quick-learning and coachable individuals.

We provide FULL TRAINING and experience in an asset but NO EXPERIENCE necessary to get started on your new career opportunity.

Pay: TBD depending on experience

Company Offers:

- Full Training

- Rapid Advancement

- Full and Part Time Positions

- Trip Incentives (Provincial and international)

- Awards

Our Ideal Candidate:
- Positive and energetic.
- Candidates must possess a positive attitude, be self-motivated, personable and enthusiastic.
- Works well individually as well as in a team environment.
- Approaches each task with a professional and positive attitude.
- Most importantly must be a trainable individual.

*All applicants must have a valid driver's license and vehicle.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent
Part-time hours: 6-40 per week

Salary: $50,685.00-$83,987.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Commission pay

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 12 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • Fire Safety Occupations: 1 year (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • drivers license (required)

title: Safety & Compliance Coordinator
description:
Solvent Buddy Inc. has been providing businesses, both large and small, with specialized equipment in waste management and industrial services since 1996. Also adding as of 2017, Chemical Cleaning to its services. Since humble beginnings on the south side of Edmonton the company has grown and now has three locations in Western Canada. Solvent Buddy provides a complete range of services into light industrial, aviation, forestry, mining, oil and gas. With that being said Solvent Buddy has a strong foundation in Safety, Integrity and Dependability.

Solvent Buddy has an exciting new entry level opportunity ideal for a recent OH&S graduate with experience or an interest and willingness to learn about Compliance; we are willing to train the right individual.

Position Summary

The Safety & Compliance Coordinator is responsible to provide general safety and administrative support for our Federally Regulated Occupational Health and Safety program; as well as expert guidance in the transportation of TDG.

This position will include, but is not limited to the processing, record-keeping and reporting of driver and employee training files for our online safety portal and requires a thorough knowledge of Federal compliance regulatory requirements and Occupational Health and Safety.

The successful candidate will have Strong Organization skills, be a Self-Starter and be Self-Directed, and is comfortable with Field Work.

This Full-Time Permanent position will be based out of our Edmonton, Alberta head office; conveniently located in the west-end close to the Anthony Henday.

Experience working with Energy Safety Canada as well as exposure to the Federally Regulated Transportation industry is a definite asset.

Safety Accountabilities

· Daily interaction with employees, ensuring Safety awareness is a top priority for all employees;

· Ensuring all employees are appropriately trained and ticketed for their assigned work;

· Ongoing maintenance of our safety portal (employee files of tickets, training ect.);

· Ensuring accident and incident investigations are conducted and recorded in our safety portal in a timely manner and implementing corrective actions to prevent future occurrence;

· Conduct serious incident investigations into high consequence incidents and near-miss events, implementing corrective actions to prevent future occurrence;

· Regular onsite job observations and BBO’s are completed at regular intervals;

· Identify Safety coaching opportunities throughout the organization, offer yourself as a Safety subject matter expert and actively participate in improving safety awareness and compliance;

· Manage WCB claims full cycle;

· Actively support the Return to Work program and processes;

· Maintain the organization’s Energy Safety Canada COR program and status;

· Support the Alcohol and Drug Policy and Program in conjunction Human Resources;

· Participate in the new hire orientation and on-boarding process in conjunction with Human Resources and Operations;

· Completion of Pre-Qualification packages and Employee Mobilization for on-site field work;

· Responsible to complete field work as necessary, ensuring a presence on all large projects and jobs;

· Inventory, order and issue PPE and consumable items;

· Regular interaction with Ownership Group, Managers, Supervisors, and Key Personnel to ensure Safety activities are incorporated into planning;

· Liaise with regulatory agents to develop effective working relationships and support regulatory compliance;

· Participation and follow up of the Workplace Joint Health and Safety Committee;

· Participate in Operations Meetings;

· Daily, Monthly, Quarterly, and Annually tasks including:

· Ensure the following required documentation is completed on a daily interval

o Daily field level hazard assessments

o Daily toolbox meetings

o Daily vehicle inspections

o Daily pre use equipment inspections (forklifts, skid steers)

· Ensure the following required documentation is completed Monthly or Quarterly (as appropriate)

o Monthly general Health and Safety meetings

o Monthly shop, office, and yard fire inspections

o Monthly fire extinguisher inspections

o Monthly ramp inspection

o Monthly water tank inspection

o Quarterly Workplace Joint Health and Safety meetings

o Conduct inventory and complete inventory report

· Ensure the following Annual action items are completed

o Energy Safety Canada COR audit as per audit cycle

o Develop and implement action plans based off COR audit findings

o Emergency Evacuation drill conducted

o Review of all written formal job hazard assessments, ensuring they meet or exceed standards

o Review of all written safe job procedures, ensuring they meet or exceed standards

o Review of all written safe work practices, ensuring they meet or exceed standards

o Review and support all company Health and Safety related policies

· Arrange, complete and follow up for Third party annual inspections as listed below

o Fire alarm system

o Emergency exit lights throughout the facility

o Fire extinguishers annual certification

o All harness and lanyards annual inspections

o Air compressor tanks annual inspection and certification

o Air ventilation system annual inspection

· Other duties as assigned

Compliance Accountabilities

· Subject matter expert of federal, and provincial transportation and hazardous materials and waste regulations related to properly qualifying regulated drivers, and all related record-keeping and reporting;

· Lead in the development of compliance programs, policies, and procedures with the least amount of impact on the operations;

· Set-up, organize, and maintain the online safety portal office filing system including confidential data;

· Enforce, perform, assist in and coordinate safety training, relating to driver and compliance training such as load securement, trip inspections, log books;

· Ensure new hires are properly trained in their daily duties to include all required paperwork related to transportation;

· Ensure compliance with all regulations and record keeping concerning all transportation matters such as National Safety Code, Carrier Profile, etc.;

· Enforce policies and standards, and ensure compliance with transport regulations;

· Monitor, Counsel, and Document driver violations of any provincial, federal, or local laws or company policies or regulations;

· Conduct investigations to determine causes of incidents;

· Direct investigations to verify and resolve customer complaints;

· Ensure Driver/Vehicle files are up-to date and properly maintained;

· Conduct monthly inventory and create inventory reports;

· Generate and maintain data and reports;

· Conduct driver road tests;

· Assist with the implementation of electronic log books;

· Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

· OHS Certificate or Diploma;

· Familiarity with Federally Regulated, Health & Safety Procedures and management system;

· Familiarity with Federally Regulated, Transportation Legislation and Compliance;

· Experience with TDG;

· 2+ years of administrative support experience;

· Strong organization skills;

· Proficient in Windows based applications;

· Strong oral and written communication skills;

· Strong attention to detail;

· Ability to work under strict deadlines;

· Able to maintain confidentiality;

· Must have an active driver’s license with no restrictions and a clean driver abstract;

· Must be able to pass an Alcohol and Drug pre-employment screening test and comply with the Solvent Buddy Inc. Alcohol and Drug Policy and Program.

Why Solvent Buddy:

· Stable Full Time Position with Full Benefits after 3 Months;

· Competitive Compensation In Recognition Of Previous Experience;

· Attractive Work-Life Balance for Quality Family Life;

· Great teamwork environment.

COVID-19 Considerations

Our Employee, Client, and Community Member's Health and Safety is priority to Solvent Buddy Inc. as such we are proud to comply with all Public Health guidelines and orders.

If this sounds interesting and you have the needed qualifications please submit your cover letter and resume today.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $65,000.00-$75,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Edmonton, AB: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Application question(s):

  • Are you able to pass a Alcohol and screen test and comply with the Alcohol And Drug policy?
  • Have you completed your OHS Diploma?

title: HSE Manager
description:
Job description
THE IDEAL FIT The ideal candidate for this position has proven experience in HSE and is seasoned in their knowledge of transportation. You have excellent interpersonal skills and enjoy working in a fast-paced environment. You strive to create meaningful relationships with stakeholders. You believe in building trust, and approach safety as a collaboration of personnel. You are resourceful with the proven ability to multi-task while demonstrating superior safety behaviour. You exhibit problem solving skills with a positive attitude and a team approach. You are able to Walk the talk by being a role model for excellent Safety Leadership

JOB SUMMARY

The Health and Safety Manager is responsible overseeing the entirety of health and safety at AFD Petroleum Ltd. You will oversee implementation/revision of existing policies, procedures, and various safety programs as they pertain to the AFD HSE & Loss Prevention Manual. The HSE Manager guides, and provides advice to the health and safety department, senior management, employees and all other departments of AFD Petroleum Ltd. The incumbent oversees the development, assessment, facilitation of all health and safety programs and initiatives to ensure a safe and healthy workplace. This position will interface with all departments to ensure existing processes and special projects are in compliance with all Federal, Provincial, and Local regulations. The Health and Safety Manager conducts site visits & audits to all our branch’s including Alaska. This is a safety sensitive role and Drug & Alcohol testing is required.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

  • Oversee the planning, development, implementation, coordination, and evaluation of AFD Petroleum Ltd.’s occupational health and safety policies, procedures and programs
  • Thorough knowledge and understanding of Department of Transportation, Federal/Provincial Motor Carrier regulations.
  • Injury / collision prevention practices & techniques.
  • Investigates vehicle accidents, injuries and safety incidents. Prepares and submits related reports as required.
  • Ability to interpret and explain regulations, rules, and policies/procedures to other
  • Manage the development of annual health and safety plans for the company based on a full review of health and safety-related needs
  • Review occupational health and safety legislation, amendments and best practices to optimize occupational health and safety programs
  • ·Provide all levels of the company with advice related to health and safety matters, legislative requirements and best practices in the field
  • Represent AFD Petroleum Ltd in matters of health and safety with the government, health and safety associations and other outside agencies and organizations
  • Provide advice and guidance to senior management on all health and safety concerns
  • Ensure all accident investigations are conducted by the health and safety department thoroughly and effectively
  • Follow-up with all workplace investigations to ensure necessary corrections to the work processes have been implemented and documented
  • Oversee the safety orientation and training for all new employees, existing employees and visitors
  • Hire, train and conduct ongoing coaching of all health and safety department staff members
  • Conduct performance reviews for all direct reports
  • Oversee and provide leadership for the annual health and safety program audit to ensure the effectiveness of occupational health and safety programs
  • Oversee internal health and safety audits of the company
  • ·Manage the coordination of inspections, investigations, and occupational health and safety of the company
  • Support and promote occupational health, wellness and safety department initiatives
  • Oversee the development and approve the occupational health and safety budget
  • Provide leadership and support to the business development team and senior management through all health and safety processes
  • Perform other related duties as required

OTHER KEY SKILLS (or product knowledge)

Computer literacy, including effective working skills of MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Adobe products and e-mail required. Working knowledge of ISNetworld, CanQUAL, Complyworks is considered an asset

EXPEREINCE

· 5 years of field safety experience,

· 3 years of commercial transportation experience is required.

· AMTA audit knowledge considered an asset.

· Strong understanding of NSC

· Experience with motor vehicle and environmental incident investigation

EDUCATION

· Safety certification training (e.g., OHS Certificate and/or NCSO Designation) is required

· Transportation Safety Professional or Coordinator certificate an asset

· Class 1 drivers license considered an asset.

· Certifications in collision investigation or related training

· Transportation Safety Professional

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY

Supervise HSE Administrator

DECISION MAKING

HSE programming and staff decisions

WORK ENVIRONMENT & PHYSICAL DEMANDS
While performing the duties of this job, the employee regularly works in an office/field setting. There may be a need to attend to situations on work sites.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to use hands and fingers to handle, feel, or operate objects, tools or controls, and reach with hands and arms. Exposure to noise, dust, odors, fumes and oils may occur. The employee is frequently required to stand, talk and listen.

POSITION TYPE/EXPECTED HOURS OF WORK
This is a full-time position. Days and hours of work are Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Some overtime and after hours’ work may be required.

TRAVEL
40% Travel to various branch’s (AB, BC, YT, Alaska) worksites and customer premises will be required.

FINANCIAL AND MEASURMENT DATA

HSE Budgets

TRIFF

KEY WORKING RELATIONSHIPS

Executive

Branch Managers

PROBLEM SOLVING (technical)

Dealing with multiple reporting software and training software

PROBLEM SOLVING (interpersonal)

Relationship building and buy in from Branch Managers

Dealing with clients on incident management

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

***This position requires pre-employment Drug and Alcohol testing***

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Commission pay

title: Fleet Helper/Delivery Driver
description:
LOOKING FOR AN AMAZING CAREER OPPORTUNITY WITH CANADA’S MOST SUCCESSFUL HOME FURNISHINGS RETAILER, THERE’S NO LIMIT TO WHERE YOU CAN GO!

Many of our most successful associates joined Leon’s in entry level positions and with hard work, determination and desire they were able to achieve a level of success beyond their imaginations. These success stories are our greatest achievement. Let our story be your story. Whatever the position, Leon’s can open the door to a bright and exciting future for you. You bring the can-do attitude and we will provide the tools for your success. Join us today!

LEON’S is currently hiring a full time Fleet Helper/Delivery Driver.

Must be available both weekday and weekends.

We are currently looking for a self-motivated warehouse associate who is enthusiastic, hardworking and driven towards success. The ideal candidates are able to handle heavy merchandise with great care while helping our valued customers turn their dream homes into reality. Our warehouse/fleet associates are regarded amongst the best in the industry because of their professionalism, integrity, skilled product handling, and commitment to providing our customers with the ultimate buying experience. As an integral member of our team, you will be responsible for loadining and unloading merchandise to and from warehouse, delivering merchandise to customers, assisting with customer pickups and deliveries. The sucessful candidate will also train to transition to a driver position. Customer service is a must! The candidate MUST be available any days of the week and hours range between 7am and 7pm.

Why Leon’s?

· Flexible schedule – we work with our staff to create a solid work/life balance.

· Build expertise through continuous training and development to ensure your success

· Great earning potential

· A generous employee discount program

· Development and career advancement opportunities

· Benefit programs

What are we looking for?

· Above all, an amazing attitude and drive for great customer service

· Your ability to handle heavy merchandise in a busy warehouse environment

· Your outstanding communication and interpersonal skills

· Your openness, approachability and sincerity

· Your integrity and drive to succeed

· Bondable

· Must have a valid Drivers License and clean driving abstract

· Your passion for continuous learning and self-development

One simple click could change your life. Apply Now

Applicants are encouraged to drop off resumes in person, but can also email.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $18.00-$23.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Licence/Certification:

  • Drivers Licence (required)

title: General Laborer (Will Train!)
description:
Job Description

Here at Modern PURAIR® Sea to Sky we are looking for enthusiastic, motivated, customer focused individuals to join our Technician Team as a "Indoor Air Quality Technician". We offer great pay & incentives. A fun, supportive & competitive work environment and thorough practical training on hard & soft skills. We are currently accepting full time applications. Experience in Sales, Skilled Labor or HVAC is not required to apply for this job position, but is a great bonus.

In this role, you will be responsible for providing Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning Cleaning for our Residential and Commercial Client bas operating your own truck route. This role includes, but is not limited to:

  • Coming down to Kelowna, BC to get trained by the highest earning technicians in the franchise system.
  • Following the PURAIR Way (our proven systems/procedures for being successful)
  • Showing up to work on-time in your clean, company provided uniform
  • Performing walkthroughs with our clients to confirm our rates prior to starting the job
  • Educating our clients on our services so they can properly make decisions
  • Using our software to invoice clients off of a company provided iPhone/iPad
  • Driving one of our Mercedes Sprinter Vans to and from job sites
  • Keeping track of your truck inventory on a daily/weekly basis
  • Being able to take instructions from an established Team Member that knows the ropes

A successful candidate will:

  • Have a positive, motivated, energetic personality
  • Able to successfully work in both team/independent environments
  • Be dedicated to exceptional customer service
  • Have a clean driver abstract and be able to pass a criminal background check
  • Enjoy a supportive and competitive environment
  • Be coachable. You are here to learn and we are happy to teach you!

Experience with the following is preferred, but not required:

  • Basic Tools (Drill, Tin Snips, pliers)
  • Ariel Work Platforms (Articulating Boomlifts, Scissor Lifts)
  • Ladders
  • HVAC systems

A “Indoor Air Quality Technician” can expect:

  • Once graduated from training and operating your own truck route, you will become part of our Profit Sharing payout structure that has no limit on the amount of income you can earn.
  • Full benefits after 90 days.
  • Company provided iPhone/iPad once in Residential Training.
  • Team building events, team dinners and joined celebration of Wins. We recently celebrated our year end at Okanagan Table enjoying a private 4 course meal and a cash bonus for all.
  • To work for a highly reputable company with a strong vision for the future that believes in Self Mastery and promoting from within.
  • 10 days paid vacation and 5 sick days.
  • Additional day of vacation for every year worked.

Please note that this position is only available at our location in Squamish, BC. We will only review applications if you complete the "Skills Test" Indeed sends you when you reply.

Work Remotely

  • YES

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $22.00-$65.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Commission pay
  • Overtime pay
  • Tips

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Discounted or free food
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • Profit sharing
  • Store discount
  • Vision care
  • Wellness program

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 12 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Night shift
  • On call
  • Overtime
  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
No

Experience:

  • HVAC & Appliance Technicians: 1 year (preferred)

title: General Manager
description:
Job Description

  • Overseeing daily operations of the business
  • Creating new strategies for growth and putting them into practice
  • Overseeing the budget and managing expenses
  • Training new staff
  • Hiring and terminating employees
  • Evaluating productivity and performance and implementing strategies for improvement

  • Problem-solving and critical-thinking skills
  • Strategic business planning
  • Social and intrapersonal skills

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $60,000.00-$120,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Commission pay

title: Ready to start your automotive apprenticeship?
description:
WHY THE OK TIRE GROUP?

At the OK Tire Group, you are more than just an employee who is part of a growing company - everyone is a respected and valued member of our team. We provide a supportive work environment, which enables personal and professional growth. With 2 stores currently and plans for expansion this could be your ticket to a lucrative opportunity.

The Management team for the group are very active in the race car community and car club communities within the Edmonton area. While first and foremost they are focused on customer and employee satisfaction, there is never a moment when they are not assisting programs like “Horsepower for Hope” (which supports the Kids with Cancer Society), the Edmonton Food Bank, Santa's Anonymous and other countless community-based programs around the stores.

Though, do not take our word for it. See what our customers and community have to say about us on Google or Facebook (OK Tire 23rd Ave, OK Tire Groat Road)!

Our team understands that providing exceptional customer service and quality workmanship is our number one priority. We believe in the values of:

  • Open and honest communication
  • Personal commitment towards success
  • Team spirited participation through learning, coaching, and mentoring

This is a position for anyone currently working somewhere who is being promised "maybe one day" you'll start the apprenticeship program. Start it now, with us. Not working anywhere and have no current experience? If you've taken the Pre-Employment program at NAIT, we know you are going to be a journeyman one day!

Here is an opportunity to grow and learn with some of the best people in the industry. Unlike the other guys, if you work for us - we work for you. We want you to grow in your career and so we are ready, from day one to help you move forward. If you want to be considered for the opportunity please only apply if you have a positive attitude, are coachable and have experience in the industry or have taken the program at NAIT (or similar). This job is a full time position for the right candidate and also a seasonal part time position.

Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Perform lube oil and filter changes
  • Mount and balance tires
  • Expect, attend, & appreciate all forms of pertinent training
  • Perform inspections on every vehicle
  • Required to effectively collect and communicate necessary information and concerns from service advisor
  • Works closely with the service advisor to inform, educate, and advise on technical issues that need to be addressed on the maintenance and repair of the client’s vehicle
  • Perform vehicle maintenance and repairs as indicated on work order, with accuracy and efficiency, in accordance with industry and manufacturer standards
  • Maintain prompt, professional, & effective non-verbal primary communication in every aspect of business
  • Maintain a clean and tidy facility
  • Guide and train newer apprentices

Qualifications / Education:

  • Possess required tools and maintain in proper working condition
  • Ability to communicate effectively (Ability to read, write, & speak English fluently)
  • Maintain valid driver’s license, must supply driver’s abstract upon request
  • Basic computer knowledge is required
  • Physically fit to perform required duties of job description
  • Bondable

Personal Attributes:

  • Demonstrates positive attitude & self-motivation
  • Meet professional appearance standards of OK Tire Group
  • Possess strong interpersonal and adaptable skills
  • Committed to a career of professionalism and top performance in the automotive industry
  • Committed to serving the client by properly maintaining their vehicle
  • Resourceful in enhancing personal skills and abilities
  • Ability to work well independently and as part of a team
  • Understands & demonstrates the ability to accept change in a positive manner
  • Must have a love of vehicles

Performance Expectations / Abilities:

  • Able to perform multiple tasks with low levels of apparent stress
  • Ability to work with minimal or no supervision
  • Take all possible precautions to ensure the safety and health of self and others through maintaining a safe work environment

Working Environment:

In order to maintain the high level of service & professionalism, and to ensure staff participation in the growth and prosperity of OK Tire Group, you will be provided with performance reviews and expected to attend regular scheduled safety, team, and industry training meetings.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Work remotely

  • No

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent, Apprenticeship

Salary: $16.00-$20.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Store discount

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Application question(s):

  • Do you have any of your own tools or safety equipment? If so, what?
  • What can you as a candidate bring to our team? (Please do not include information listed on your resume)
  • Have you taken the NAIT Pre-Employment program, a comparable program or more advanced post-secondary courses?

Experience:

  • automotive technician: 1 year (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Drivers License (required)

title: General Labourer (Will Train!)
description:
Here at Modern PURAIR® we are looking for enthusiastic, customer focused people to join our Technician Team. We offer competitive pay, great incentives, a fun, supportive work environment and thorough practical training.


We are currently accepting full time applications.

NO EXPERIENCE REQUIRED.

ROOM FOR ADVANCEMENT (Project Management, Operations Management, General Manager, Business Development, Sales etc.)

In this role, you will be responsible for:
  • Driving one of our shiny, new Mercedes Sprinter Vans to customer locations at their homes or businesses for pre-scheduled appointments
  • Speaking with customers about the process
  • Using the PURAIR Vacuum and cleaning system to clean the heating, ventilation, and air conditioning (HVAC) system following PURAIR® training and protocol
  • Using our iPad-based invoice and payment authorization system to process customer payments at the job site
  • Keeping your PURAIR Mercedes Sprinter Van properly stocked and ready for work
A successful candidate will:
  • Have a positive, energetic personality
  • Be dedicated to exceptional customer service
  • Have a clean driver abstract and be able to pass a criminal background check
  • Enjoy a supportive and competitive environment
  • Income potential of 60K in your first year of employment
  • Company benefits after 90 days probation
  • Company provided Ipad and Iphone
  • Have open work availability (Please note that to be considered, candidates must have flexible schedules and be able to work weekends)
  • Be able to earn up to $75,000 per year!

We thank all applicants for their interest. Due to the volume of applications received, only those qualified for an interview will be contacted.

title: PT Shuttle Driver - Edmonton North
description:
Before you apply to a job, select your language preference from the options available at the top right of this page.

Explore your next opportunity at a Fortune Global 500 organization. Envision innovative possibilities, experience our rewarding culture, and work with talented teams that help you become better every day. We know what it takes to lead UPS into tomorrow—people with a unique combination of skill + passion. If you have the qualities and drive to lead yourself or teams, there are roles ready to cultivate your skills and take you to the next level.

Job Description:

Become part of a dedicated team at a Fortune Global 500 organization. Envision innovative possibilities, experience our rewarding culture, and work with talented teams that help you become better every day. We know what it takes to lead UPS into tomorrow—people with a unique combination of skill + passion. If you have the qualities and drive to lead yourself or teams, there are roles ready to cultivate your skills and take you to the next level.

Job Summary
This is a part-time position that will be running the airport and 5-ton shuttle to the Edmonton North depot in the early morning. This position practices safe transportation methods while traveling to and from destinations. This position ensures the best customer service through efficiency and dedication. Shift is from Monday-Friday with a 4am start time and a 9am end time. *Shift end may vary depending on operational needs*


Responsibilities:
Delivers and picks up UPS packages efficiently and effectively.
Learns and properly executes UPS safe driving methods.

Qualifications:

  • Occasionally lifting up to 70lbs- handcarts available
  • Valid AB Class 5 non-GDL license
  • No at-fault accidents or more than 5 demerit points in the past three years prior to applying
  • No tickets or moving violations in the past 12-months prior to applying
  • No 5-ton experience required, will train the right candidate
  • Salary: Starting wage is $16 + $2 hourly bonus *current top rate is $27.63 after 4 years.

UPS Canada is a diverse and equal opportunity employer. Please advise our HR representatives if workplace accommodation is needed. Thank you for your interest in UPS Canada.

title: Housekeeper - $21.75/hr
description:
Why Vacasa

We started with just one home and an idea: to bring homeowners and renters together with smart technology and caring local teams. Today, we're the largest full-service vacation rental company in North America thanks to the people who give us their best every day. You'll fit right in here if you're curious, entrepreneurial, and thrive in a rapid-growth environment.

Compensation:

  • $21.75-23.00 CAD/hr
  • $500 Retention Bonus

What you'll get

  • Health/dental/vision insurance—100% coverage option
  • Employer Sponsored & Voluntary Supplemental Benefits
  • Registered Retirement Savings Plan
  • Health & Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts
  • Paid vacation & sick days
  • Paid holidays
  • Paid parental leave after one year of tenure
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Career advancement opportunities
  • Employee discounts
  • All the equipment you'll need to be successful
  • Great colleagues and culture
  • Monetary value of benefits equals about $300 per month!
  • Please visit our careers page to review our full benefits offerings

Why Housekeeping at Vacasa

We take pride in our work, knowing our tireless efforts provide peace of mind. We're the vacation heroes—giving guests a spotless first impression and setting the tone for an unforgettable experience. With us, you're more than just a housekeeper, you're a keeper of the house.

What we're looking for

We're searching for an exceptional individual to join our team as a Housekeeper in Whistler This person is a hard-working individual who will embody our values while maintaining the supreme cleanliness of our homes.

What you'll do

  • Professionally clean and maintain Vacasa properties using cleaning procedures and products in conformance with prescribed company standards
  • Sweeping, vacuuming, mopping, dusting, and washing all surfaces
  • Move all reasonably portable furniture in rooms to clean under and behind
  • Assist with laundry as needed
  • Create a welcoming environment for our guests and owners by ensuring homes are clean and cared for
  • Identify and note any damages to homes. Create maintenance tickets as necessary
  • Collect and remove trash and debris
  • Meet and maintain required Housekeeping metrics
  • Attend all mandatory individual and team meetings
  • Replenish consumable items such as soaps and paper products
  • Maintain hot tubs as needed; no experience necessary - we offer on-site training
  • Other responsibilities as assigned - because every day looks different

The skills you'll need and position requirements

  • Reliable transportation
  • Smartphone and personal email address
  • Weekend availability
  • Attention to detail
  • No experience required, we're happy to train you!
  • Ability to stand for extended periods of time, bend, stoop, squat, kneel and lift over 20 pounds

Must be legally eligible to work in Canada. Vacasa is unable to assist candidates in obtaining Canadian work authorization.

Some positions may require that you drive a personal vehicle and/or company vehicle for work purposes. Employees who are required to drive a personal vehicle must have reliable transportation, a valid driver's license, and be at least 18 years of age. Employees who are required to drive a company vehicle must have a valid driver's license, be at least 21 years of age, and have been a licensed driver for no less than 3 years.

Vacasa is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We do not discriminate against applicants based upon race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, or other classes protected by applicable law.

Vacasa is committed to maintaining a safe and productive work environment. Possession, use, or being under the influence of alcohol or illegal drugs in the workplace is prohibited.

An offer of employment for this role will be contingent upon the successful completion of a background check.
